Reviews.Title: “A left bank gem”
Reviews.Author: MiamiAmore
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel de l'Abbaye last May on our way to Florence. We spent a beautiful three days in Paris, and the hotel is so wonderfully charming that it entices one to linger, even though the city's sightseeing beckons. The Hotel sits within a cozy courtyard, in a classic French building, which used to house and old abbey. It is inviting to pause in the warmly decorated sitting room before venturing further. Our room was of good size - there are larger rooms if one is willing to pay a bit more- with a large window overlooking the courtyard, chintzy fabrics and a cozy bed that made us want to sleep late. Perhaps the best part was breakfast, which is served in the elegant conservatory, or in fair weather, the incredibly charming garden. A continental breakfast is included in the price of the room, which is not common in Paris, while everything else on the menu is a la carte and very delicious. There was a regal assortment of breads and pastries, and the cafe au lait was divine! The hotel is conveniently located, close to St. Germain Boulevard, great restaurants and metro stations. We have been to Paris several times and stayed in many good hotels, but this one is, by far, the most memorable one. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and intimate”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer-north
Reviews.Content: I love small intimate hotels -no big chain please!- with charm and character and Hotel de l'Abbaye in Paris fits the bill perfectly: wonderful old building, quiet street, great garden (where one can enjoy a drink in summer), wonderful common rooms with a fireplace, bright and elegant sunroom, pretty decorations and furniture -all in traditional french style-, smallish but adequate and wonderfully decorated rooms. It's also convenient, close to good restaurants and the subway and one can easily walk to various attractions (great Luxembourg gardens, perfect for children with marionette shows and extensive activities). We have already stayed twice in this hotel and do not regret our choice: it will be our home away from home when in Paris. The staff is attentive and can recommend restaurants, help make reservations etc. The breakfast in the morning is continental only but fresh with a great choice of pastries and breads. Only little downside is that while the owners schedule regular updates of rooms, if you stay in a room which is coming up for a renovation, things may look a bit tired or less crisp/polished than in the newer rooms. So it's worth asking for a room which has just been redone. Rooms overlooking the gardens are also very nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “wake up to the sound of birds and fountain”
Reviews.Author: DelfinaOslo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights. We asked for a quiet room on arrival and were assigned to a very nice room with big windows facing the gardens. It was great to wake up to the sound of birds and fountain, not traffic, in central Paris. The room itself was not big but totally charming with classic French interior and thick embroidered draperies. There was no minibar or fridge, but otherwise the room was very convenient with lots of storage place, so it was easy to keep everything tidy. The room service was there several times a day and made the room and bed perfect. Everything was very clean at all time. The continental breakfast was very nice, and you could also choose between many newspapers to catch up with recent news. There is plenty of food to order at additional price if you do not fancy continental breakfast. The breakfast restaurant itself is totally charming, facing the garden with lots of different birds catching their own breakfast. Too bad the weather was too cold to eat outside. All i all, a very nice experience. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “short stay in paris on the left bank”
Reviews.Author: Susaneppley
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. It is on the left bank, in St. Germain and in a peaceful setting. A 17th century convent that was transformed into a boutique hotel. The metro was 5 minutes away, and easy to walk to the Seine. The staff were professional, and helpful with adapting to France. We do not speak French and the staff made us feel comfortable. The room was a basic room, and somewhat small, but clean and quiet. The bathroom was fine, but the tub was difficult to shower. The complimentary breakfast, had excellent breads, and espresso. Our server was superb.He made us feel at home, and he had a quiet, but efficient way of taking care of us. This was our first trip to Paris, and I would recommend this hotel and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “a glorious French hotel, right in the heart of St Germain”
Reviews.Author: ace_adventura
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel. Utterly French, right down to the rather elaborate patterned fabrics and wallpapers that proliferate everywhere. The room we had (a regular sized one) was absolutely fine for the several days we spent there, and the lounge area next to reception is a lovely place to take a drink by the proper log fire. The complimentary continental breakfast is lovely - lots of breads and pastries, with great coffee. Avoid the room that is next to the ground-floor lounge area (i recall it was No 15) but otherwise all the rooms are very pleasant and the courtyard must be a real treat in summer. Welcoming, comfortable, quiet and good-value hotels are increasingly rare in Paris. But this is one of them.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CocoCParis
Reviews.Content: When in Paris, I much prefer to stay at small boutique hotels rather than large chains such as Marriott or Hilton. Hotel L'Abbaye is the perfect Parisian boutique hotel in one of the most charming neighborhoods in the city where it is so convenient to almost everything. I always feel like it is a home away from home when traveling to Paris. The staff are so friendly and welcoming. The hotel has an inviting, calm, and warm atmosphere. The rooms are large by European standards and extremely comfortable. I always look forward to returning to the Hotel L'Abbaye - it makes my Paris travel experience that much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great left bank choice”
Reviews.Author: trigger1070
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a 2nd time dec 2011. We did change our room from the deluxe to the jr. Suite. The staff was ready to help and made our move easy. Be sure if morning noise bothers you to ask for a room facing the gardens. we are returning the beginning of feb 2012. The staff is excellent, the hotel manager great. Try pizza chic on the corner for one of the best pizzas in the world if you desire a salad pizza and wine supper. The hotel is excellentL

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael98830
Reviews.Content: This well situated hotel close to the metro and streets with smart boutique shops has understated elegance. The reception staff are professional without being overbearing and the cosy, clean, well furnished lounge gives you a good feeling as soon as you enter. The hand held shower is a dis-advantage in the standard rooms unless you are prepared to upgrade - but for a short trip you can put up with it. The continental breakfast has Paris written all over it and is served in the room any time you want at no extra cost. Michael

Reviews.Title: “So lovely!”
Reviews.Author: SallyB2
Reviews.Content: This has become my favorite hotel in Paris. I have stayed there 3 times now. The rooms are nicely decorated, and some look over the entrance courtyard (my favorites). The hotel is vey quiet - you will sleep well here. The housekeepers are charming and efficient. The reception staff are outstanding, and will do everything to help you. Maybe its just my impression but I got the feeling that most of them love their job. They certainly go the extra mile. They booked me restaurants (places I would never have found without them) and endless taxis as I hate the metro even though here are two stops nearby. For me the reception staff make or break a hotel (the haughty and disinterested ladies at the reception at the Conrad Dublin please take note!). Most of all, I love the downstairs, with cozy lounges and comfortable sofas and armchairs. They do light lunches and snacks all day and they are to die for. I love coming back here after a long day slogging around Paris and sinking into a sofa and ordering a tea or a glass of vin! The reservation process is impeccable and I have never once found a mistake on my bill despite the numerous drinks and meals I had. This is one of the nicest small hotels in Paris. It is small, it is not the Ritz or the Plaza Athenee, but it is not mean to be. It is a charming small hotel in Paris, the sort we all dream of finding. The location is vey convenient. The other guests are nice too! Well done Hotel de l'Abbaye!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful as usual”
Reviews.Author: clinton_sandra
Reviews.Content: Returned for a stay with our 2 children. We had a junior suite and they stayed down the hall in a standard room. Walking into the courtyard in the evening with its christmas lights after a day exploring Paris is one of those memorable moments. Front desk staff unusually helpful and came up with great restaurant recommendations at the last minute. Room luxurious and a decent size for Paris. Small but very practical bathroom. Evening drinks in front of a roaring fire in the lounge and delicious breakfasts with huge bowls of coffee and proper fresh orange juice. This is a real little treasure. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Huuhu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in any number of hotels in Paris and the Hotel de l'Abbaye remains my absolute favorite hotel. Just returned today after spending the last few days there..probably my fifth or sixth stay. The staff is the truly the finest, charming rooms, and beautifully decorated public rooms. Great location as well. You will be hard pressed to find a better property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: mediumchris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel de L'Abbaye last fall and had a wonderful time. The hotel is charming and the location is great. The neighborhood has tons of character and the hotel was close to the Metro stop at Saint Sulpice so it was easy to get anywhere in Paris. As others have mentioned, the front desk staff is excellent at suggesting restaurants - we simply said "we're in the mood for..." and they always had a great suggestion. Some of the rooms are a bit small so we upgraded to a bigger room, which was nice. Get ready for the elevator though, it's tiny. It's not a typical American tourist hotel in a big box so if that's what makes you feel comfortable it's probably not for you. That said, if you enjoy a place that feels a bit more authentic and local, this could be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie H
Reviews.Content: Our group of 8 traveled for a birthday celebration and ended up having the trip of a lifetime. The staff at the Hotel de l'Abbaye went above and beyond to make our stay perfect. From the delicious breakfast each morning to assisting with travel information, chilling wine that we had purchased during the day, to rearranging furniture in the salon so that we all might sit comfortably together. We did not need to ask for anything, the staff was always on step ahead of us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: CamilleNortheast
Reviews.Content: Every detail in this hotel seems to have been chosen with thought and good taste, from the works of art to the flower arrangements to the light switches. The entrance is set back from the quiet street and there is a sense of calm and beauty once inside. Every staff member is gracious and unhurried. The person who served the extraordinarily good coffee at breakfast greeted us with a smile and asked if we had slept well, which we always did in our quiet and comfortable room. Two of our favorite places to eat are within three or four blocks. Restaurant du Luxembourg, 44 rue d'Assas, open for lunch and dinner, serves seasonal and perfectly prepared food in a low-key and relaxed atmosphere. The clientele is French, but the owners speak English and give Americans an especially warm welcome. Cafe Cassette, just around the corner from the hotel, also specializes in fresh vegetables, salads and fish. You can stop in early or late and get either a three-course meal or something light. The magic of the Hotel de l'Abbaye might be that you feel so well taken care of there. No part of the experience, from arrival to departure, is left to chance. They are, as the French say, "aux petits soins" to make your stay a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Left Bank Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nobutterface
Reviews.Content: this is the third time we have stayed at Hotel de l"Abbaye in Paris, and we look forward to returning soon. The staff is kind and helpful, and English is understood and spoken. The rooms are small, but charming. Breakfast is served either in the garden room or the salon, and the bread is delicious! The location is wonderful; easy to walk anywhere and in a wonderful area for exploring. We love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This is one fine hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bingob
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here over a dozen times since 1999. It NEVER disappoints. The classic bedrooms are small, so if you want a large bedroom, go to the Ritz, Crillon, Hilton, etc. If you want attentive, friendly, classic European service that outperforms the above mentioned, choose Hotel de l'Abbaye. You'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Our 23rd stay at this special hotel, need I say more?”
Reviews.Author: palominogrigo
Reviews.Content: Yes, our 23rd stay within a 12 year period. This charming hotel with its most hospitable staff has consistently delighted us, beyond belief, for years. It is perfectly located in the bustling 6th Arrondissement of Paris [(a short stroll to the haunts of the 1920s Lost Generation), fabulous shopping (including the Bon Marche department store and epicurean market, the Sunday marche biologique on Rue Raspial) Saint Sulplice, cafes, jazz clubs, the Luxembourg Gardens] yet it is a gem of tranquility and quietness with its courtyard garden. Hotel de L’Abbaye’s extraordinary attention to detail manifests itself in many ways - from the unique fresh flower arrangements and the fire in the lobby on cold days to French chocolates on Easter and a bouquet of lily of the valley on May 1st added to your breakfast tray, comfortable beds, great linens and a well designed use of a small room space. It is always a pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Gernmain”
Reviews.Author: anselmo18
Reviews.Content: A stylish well kept refuge with friendly staff and great service. The rooms are small but appealing. It's not cheap but for a night or two recovering from the misery of transatlantic flight, a stay here is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “An establishment of high quality....”
Reviews.Author: Morphie
Reviews.Content: My only regret is that it has taken me so long to write the review. I heard about the Hotel de L'Abbaye from some well regarded travel agents, years ago. We did not stay there during our prior trips; however, I did file the information away for future reference, recalling how highly regarded this hotel was amongst professionals. They were not incorrect. In the week that we were in Paris, I cannot recall one instance where the staff were anything other than helpful and courteous. While my daughter is fluent in french, I, alas, have descended into mediocrity (perhaps in many things). That having been said, the staff never let me feel handicapped for a second. They transitioned from french to english seamlessly, even tolerating my amalgam of french, english and latin. A word, if you will, about the left vs. the right bank. I favor the former, because of the intimacy and ability to live in neighborhoods as opposed to the broad avenues across the river. To be sure, there are adherents to both locales; the left asks you to accommodate smaller rooms due to the intimacy of the real estate. I find this an acceptable trade off for the ambiance and location. However, this is a personal decision. There are less expensive hotels (and those that are more pricey); however, few will enhance your vacation as much as the staff at L'Abbaye.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience and hospitality - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ScottCT_01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel de l'Abbaye for 3 nights for our first trip to Paris together, and the hotel was an absolute treat. Located in the 6th arrondissemont, the hotel provides a location that is privately tucked away but very close to restaurants and nightlife. Start with the walk to Cafe Cassette right down the street, sit down and grab a nice glass of white wine or coffee and watch the world go by. Or, walk 10 minutes to the Odeon area with great restaurants, nightlife and gelato! And of course, for tourists, walk 30 minutes to see the Louvre and Notre Dame. For everything else, the Saint Sulpice metro station is steps away from the hotel and connects you with all of Paris. We stayed in a standard room on the 4th floor, with a nice view of the inner courtyard, terraces and the beautiful buildings in the area. The room was immaculate and was very intimate and cozy, which was perfect for a romantic trip to Paris. Even though it was on the small side, it was exactly what we needed - a bed, enough room for luggage, a desk and a bathroom w/ tub. Only complaint - a shower curtain would have been nice! if you're in Paris, you're hopefully not spending a long time in your room during the day. The front desk was wonderful. We could either speak our broken French or our English with the front desk - either will work just fine. One night, we needed help with a dinner reservation - they suggested an excellent place down the street and booked our reservation for us. In the morning, definitely take the breakfast at the hotel which they serve from around 7-11. It has a bed and breakfast feeling to it, with warm service an assortment of croissants and pastries, or omelets and hot breakfast if you wish. I even had to..ugh...take a work call on our last day there. I connected to the free wi-fi through Skype with no issues. Very easy to connect, which kept our mobile bills down during our travels. Hotel de'l Abbaye provided us with a memorable, romantic first trip to Paris that we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect base to explore paris”
Reviews.Author: tah18
Reviews.Content: Charming base in the St. Germain area. A perfect location, as it was a 10-20 minute walk to almost every 'major' Paris attraction, and an easy subway ride to most others. The staff was helpful, if a little stiff and formal. Yes, the rooms were small, but what you'd expect from a city. They were also totally charming. The breakfast was simple (tea, coffee, juice and a generous breadbasket of croissant), and you had the (expensive) option of ordering more traditional western fare. I'd wanted to have the "Parisian experience" of going out to bakeries and getting our own breakfast at bakeries and cafes, but I ended up being grateful to have a quiet relaxed start to each day in their pretty courtyard. I'd recommend asking for a room in the back, as the front seemed to be a little noisy. Our Paris itinerary, in case anyone finds it helpful. We were there for 4 days. Day one- Louvre, Orangerie, Tulleires, Nap to take the edge off Jet Lag, dinner at a delicious place that the hotel recommended. Day two- Walking in the latin quarter, left bank, Notre Dame and St. Chappelle, lunch from along Rue Clare, Monmartre, Dinner (after a pleasant wait and several bottles of wine) at the bar attached to Frenchie (worth the wait, but if you're magically able to get a reservation at the restaurant, I'm sure that'd be amazing. They're closed weekends.) Day 3. Giverney. Took the advice from guidebooks and this website and got the early (8.15) train. I see the attraction of being there before the major crowds, but in retrospect would either A)taken a tour or B) have waited for the 10- something train. It's beautiful, but we really didn't need 4 hours there, and getting up early took away from the "vacation" feel. Also be warned that the bus that makes trips between Giverney and the train station does NOT go back for every train. (There are more trains than there are buses, and they don't make that clear, so print out a train schedule ahead of time and be willing to call a taxi if you don't want to wait.) Lunch, Afternoon and dinner in the Marais district. Day 4. (First Sunday of the month- free museum day!) Musee d'Orsee, Rodin Museum, Eiffel tower. Full but wonderful, and having such a nice hotel within such easy distance to come back to really made a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Enough, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Astilbe_Arendsii
Reviews.Content: Felt cramped, even by Paris hotel standards. The garden dining area had birds flocking everywhere (pleasant but not when on your table), and a mouse ran under our table. Service was a bit clipped and a bit stiff, staffing a bit uneven. Front desk guy called in sick one day (according to waiter) and this threw table service into complete disarray. I just expected a bit more at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful relaxing oasis in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mariesteckmest
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at Hotel de l'Abbaye 29 years ago and it has gotten even more charming over the years. My favorite part of the hotel is the outdoor tree shaded patio where we ate breakfast and relaxed later in the day while listening to the fountain. The delicious breakast pastries are from the bakery around the corner. The friendly front desk staff is very helpful. L'Abbaye is on a quiet street in the 6th centrally located near restaurants, shopping, the Blvd Raspail farmers' market, San Supplice and Jardin de Luxembourg.

Reviews.Title: “This is my favorite Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Katie N
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel de l'Abbaye this past Spring with a good friend and loved it. I should say, I've been to Paris nine or ten times and have stayed at many different hotels (from the Relais de I can't Remember to the Plaza Athenee), but this one is my favorite and I've been to it three times. It is simply the epitome of Paris charm. Tucked away on a quiet street in Saint-Germain, the doors at the street open to a charming cobblestone courtyard entryway. The hotel itself is a converted 15th Century Abbey, with ivy on the exterior and a variety of interior winding staircases, including in some of the rooms. We had a room on the third floor, considered a "duplex apartment," and it was just beautiful. The first floor has a foyer, full bathroom, generously sized living room with a fireplace - all decorated in lovely colors, including fabric wall coverings, matching drapes, triple thick moldings. The full staircase winds around up to the bedroom, which decorated in complimentary colors, with full view from all the window of the roof tops and the enitire neirborhood. The bedroom has an additional bathroom and frenchdoors leading out to a lovely furnished balcony (complete with topiaries and ivy), where if you choose, you can have your complimentary breakfast brought out to you each morning. Just delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly one of thr best hotels I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Poozelwallop
Reviews.Content: Hotel de l'Abbaye is one of the loveliest hotels I've been lucky enough to stay in. It was recommended by a friend for our first night of honeymoon and it exceeded expectations entirely. The room was beautiful and the service was impeccable. I really couldn't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, but the room and staff leave a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: HYNsDad
Reviews.Content: We chose to come back to this hotel, but were greatly disappointed. The location is good, in the middle of the 6th, and within easy walking distance from everywhere. The hotel building is pretty, with a lovely courtyard garden and sun room. The rooms are the hotel's weak spot, and simply do not provide descent value for money. We booked their Deluxe room, and asked for one facing the courtyard. Despite our efforts we simply could not get a descent room. One room was facing a wall, another was so small we could not fit a suitcase, and yet another had twin beds where we asked for a double. We had the distinct feeling that the staff at the front desk could not be bothered to try and find a solution.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful, and magical place to stay!! A jewel box with the most wonderful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: ahbender
Reviews.Content: Visiting Paris with my teenage daughter and friend and her teenage daugher we had to leave an apartment with no a/c we were in due to the extreme heat. It was the week leading up to men's fashion week so hotel space was almost none and many hotels were raising their rates to 4X what they normally charged. Hotel L"Abbaye found space for us and took us in and literally MADE our trip to Paris!! It was so wonderful every time we stepped foot in the hotel from a long day, etc. The private garden in the back and the cozy rooms to enjoy off of the reception were simply beautiful and inviting. Our rooms though small, were well appointed, cool, and extremely comfortable. The staff made us feel as if we were part of their family and helped us anytime we needed with a smile and more! I would never stay anywhere else but here when visiting Paris again!!! Thank you so much Hotel L'Abbaye for the trip and stay of a lifetime in this wonderful city....

Reviews.Title: “they said it would be small...”
Reviews.Author: CatherineMartin29867
Reviews.Content: My husband said they told him it would be tight with a cot brought in for our grandson but I was shocked when I saw how small... the cot with continental breakfast was an extra $115.00 a night .When I complained, the manager said we were told and they were doing me a favor by letting another person [8 years old] stay in the room. The first morning there my husband brought in a pot of coffee... the next morning I went to the front desk and asked if I could take some coffee up to the room.I was told "we do not do things like that ...someone will bring it up to you."I stated that my husband did it yesterday... the man RUDELY snapped "this is not a cafeteria." I paid approximately $ 450.00 a night to be talked to like that.... never again!! also saggy mattresses and old blankets...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: rdogg3
Reviews.Content: We ended up here by luck - actually, it was the Hotel Gare de Lyon which was so bad, it made us seek out another hotel. We found the Hotel de L'Abbaye and it was wonderful. Real class for about the same price - perhaps even less! Wonderful, elegant rooms, friendly service, wonderful quiet safe neighborhood. We would recommend this place to anyone going to Paris who wants a good experience. "Danielle" at the front desk gave us directions to a fantastic local restaurant that was to die for. Don't sell yourself short by staying in a flea bag or some place that's near a train station just because...we made that mistake, and found happiness just a short cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Still a fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fishskis
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel. It is still fantastic. The location cannot be beat; centrally located in St. Germain, on a nice quiet side street, I cannot imagine a better location. Secondly, the service is world class. The front desk and concierge staff are very competent and always helpful. The rooms are always cleaned and taken care of, but you never know how or when they took care of them. When you ask for ice or room service, it appears right after you hang up the phone The standard rooms are compact, but wonderfully functional; but a couple would find the deluxe rooms more comfortable. The design is what I would call country french, and a bit feminine for my taste (I am a guy), but so what. One little quibble I have (and I am hyper-sensitive to this issue) is the scented candles they use constantly, infusing the hotel's air with the scent of patchouli/ Indian incense. I do not like fragrance in general, and I particularly do not like their fragrance of choice. My only other complaint is that the towels are thin and rough; I just don't get this in a hotel of this quality - get soft thick towels please! The wifi is a new system and works very well. I can't wait to return to Paris and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Area buzzing but hotel lovely and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: AussieSmallfry
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed at Hotel de l'Abbaye and were very pleased with not only its central location but also its helpful staff and elegant accommodation (we initially stayed in a deluxe room and then upgraded to a junior suit for our last night after a side trip to the Loire Valley) The staff were quick to assist when we had a drama with our credit cards and were full of useful tips for restaurants, directions, day trips (we enjoyed a Paris Authentic http://www.parisauthentic.com/ trip to Versailles) etc. Each morning we awoke looking forward to the yummy breakfast in the gorgeous courtyard, almost tempted to linger for a while but Paris was calling...only a short metro ride away as well as lots of tempting retail therapy right on the hotel's door stop.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: creynold02
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a brief stay in Paris. I found Hotel de l'Abbaye from tripadvisor and I am so glad I chose to stay here. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and elegantly decorated. A beautiful breakfast was included in the lovely garden area. I love the fact that the hotel in a courtyard off the street. It is almost like being in the french countryside. The best part of the hotel is the back garden area with the beautiful trees, flowers and fountain. It was so idyllic sitting out there, we actually sat there for over 2 hours one afternoon just enjoying tea and our surroundings. The staff are very friendly. To make the Hotel de l'Abbaye perfect I would just ask management to include slippers and robes in the hotel rooms. But that is the only thing I would say they need to improve. Even without slippers I have found my new hotel in Paris! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, lovely hotel, would come back!!”
Reviews.Author: Heiners
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend. This was my first time to Paris and I was well looked after at Hotel de l'Abbaye. Great interiors including a bath and sensational location for conquering Paris by foot or metro. Surrounded by amazing shopping and a 5 min walk to Louvre. Breakfast was tasteful and great service. Lovely open fire place to enjoy some cheese and wine after a long day in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Ruchei
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small. Once we put down the suitcases, there was not that much space on the floor left. The breakfast was wonderful - loved the hot chocolate and the pastries. The location was great too - next to 2 metro stops, yet we always got them confused somehow and ended up walking around the block several times. The reception stuff was Ok. We did not feel particularly welcome. From reading other reviews, I felt I could ask the stuff about restaurant reservations, and it did not go too well - the receptionist looked at me strangely when I asked about a particular restaurant, made the reservation for us with no questions asked, and then we learned that it was one of the very expensive restaurants in the city....we made it all the way there to realize we could not afford a $300 dinner. It was a decent place, but I would not stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: adstew
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon and everything about this place was perfect. A great location to exploring Paris -- walkable to plenty, with the subway right around the corner. The staff was welcoming, the courtyard and morning breakfast was charming and our room was so nice we had to motivate ourselves to leave and explore the city. I'd highly recommend this for a couple seeking a romantic experience in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Paris as it is”
Reviews.Author: brigitpswe
Reviews.Content: Rooms are so typical parisian style, service was great and they were very welcoming to us. As we were travel agents, we even got a discount, that was extremly nice from them as usually in Paris you dont get any discount. Room was small, but in Paris I guess you dont expect more than that, loby was cozy and it had a special atmosphere in the air because it was very cold outside. Breakfast was tipical croissan with cofee. All together, we loved it. Hotel was more empty then full in this period of a year, so I guess they had more time to give only to us. All together, nice stay which will stay as a nice memory!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, quiet, delightful, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Heidi2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Abbaye for our anniversary the past two Januarys . The staff was extremely attentive, rooms were beautifully decorated and the cafe/lounge that looks onto the courtyard absolutely delightful- a perfect setting for delicious morning croissants and coffee...in winter cozy fires in downstairs. Everything on the small size, as one would expect in Paris (or NY).

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: steve111047
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and cute mice running around the floor. Beyond that, the hotel is very unimpressive. I think managment has done a great job marketing to English speakers (including posting comments on this site). However, given the price, small rooms, and smell, look elsewhere (Hotel St Germain, Belechasse, etc). For management-please take the traps away and have a professional remove the mice without killing them.

Reviews.Title: “Met all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: drewaz
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the recommendation of a friend and the TA reviews. We stayed 5 night and totally enjoyed our stay. The room as exceptional, the bed was comfortable and the shower was great. The staff made our visit comfortable and the public rooms were wonderfully relaxing after a jaunt into the madness of Paris. The location can't be beat. Our only disappointment was the breakfast ... not much except a drink and bread.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant place to be in Paris. A true gem.”
Reviews.Author: Antonio_spaulo
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris for a 5 days stay in late september and we decided to stay in this hotel considering the location and reviews. It was an excellent decision. Staff , location, attention, peace to rest and to talk. The only bad things are the breakfast without fruits and the tiny little bed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, romantic hotel in a perfect neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: NorthCarolinaRoxy
Reviews.Content: I spent months combing through reviews to pick the perfect Parisian hotel. I am so happy I selected Hotel de l'Abbaye. We had a nicely decorated room (#4) located on the ground floor that had a sun enclosure and a private patio next to the gardens (made private by greenery). The bathroom was very modern with a marble & glass shower with great water pressure. From the minute you arrive you are made to feel welcome with a nice continental breakfast which included a bread basket - croissants, mini baguettes, & an apple pastry - fresh squeezed juice & coffee or hot chocolate. It was plenty of breakfast to start the day yet leave room for a mid-morning snack at any of the hundreds of patisseries you may pass. The lobby is a series of small rooms each with their own charm. Each afternoon we came home to a nice fire in the fireplace. The location is perfect - down a side street set back by an inner courtyard. At night we heard nothing. It is amazing to me to be located in the heart of Paris and to hear no city noise - traffic, sirens, garbage trucks, etc. - We slept great. The front desk staff were very helpful. We worked mostly with Mr. Rossignol & he was terrific - very pleasant & always eager to help. I almost hate to say anything negative but to go from very good to perfect the things I would change are the following: 1) have slippers available in the room - it would be nice to get out of the shower throw on your robe & have breakfast in your room without putting on shoes or walking barefoot on the carpet, 2) provide plusher less scratchy towels & sheets, 3) make sure the amenities are replinished - we had only 1 small bottle of evian in our room for 4 days - it would have been nice to have a bottle each day for taking pills or quenching your thirst without having to remember to stop & buy one - on several days our shampoos, etc. were not replaced, 4) place a nice french chocolate on the pillow at turndown & 5) have some afternoon treat available in the lobby i.e. hot chocolate & madelines - Yes, these are small things & in no way would stop me from returning - But I think these above & beyond niceties would place this hotel in a category with other 4 star American hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel, and a perfect stay in a most beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: SweetShepherd
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de l' Abbaye was everything we could have asked for in a hotel. It was our first trip to Paris and both the city and the hotel met and exceeded all of our expectations. The Hotel de l' Abbaye was perfectly located within walking distance of most of the sights in central Paris. It is a small, charming, quiet oasis tucked away on the Rue Cassette, in a very busy, exciting city, but still very close to a huge array of restaurants, shops, gardens, and museums. The staff was very charming, helpful, professional and efficient. Our room was immaculate, charmingly French, quiet, and overlooked a lovely interior courtyard. Breakfast was attentively served each morning in the interior courtyard, and included café au lait, freshly squeezed fruit juice, and assorted pastries. We stayed in a upgraded, superior room which was comfortable, spacious, tastefully appointed, with a large, luxurious bathroom, all of which overlooked the courtyard and the ancient roof tops of the Latin Quarter of Paris. The price was more than we normally pay for a hotel, but not an outrageous price for a centrally located hotel in the Latin Quarter of Paris. I cannot for the life of me imagine how they could have made my stay any more pleasant. If we are fortunate enough to ever return to Paris, I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Pammie56
Reviews.Content: A real oasis in an excellent location. Charmimg staff, delightful decor.......We chose a duplex which had its own balcony. How great it was to have our own private outside space in which to have breakfast and a rest after a day sightseeing before going out for the evening. The rooms were as a parisian apartment would be, period and chic combined. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fishskis
Reviews.Content: I had an almost perfect stay at this hotel. Located in the heart of St. Germain, You could not a pick a better location in Paris. This is a smallish charming hotel with an old world feel. the service is extraordinary; as good as any hotel I have ever stayed at (Four Seasons, etc.). I was concerned the Classic Room would be too small, but it was not; though not huge, it was perfectly designed and thoughtfully laid out, with ample closet space. My only (small) complaints are: 1) The A/C, though functional, was not quite sufficient for me (I like very good A/C). I would be concerned as to how the A/C might perform in hot weather....2) There is no refrigerator in the room. Though the hotel will whisk ice up to your room in about 7 seconds, and you can use the hotel's refrigerator to keep anything perishable, it is not the same as having your own fridge, particularly if you want to keep some food in your room. 3) The wifi, though it worked, was particularly cumbersome in that you had to keep re-registering over and over agin to connect. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Paris in the coming months.

Reviews.Title: “charming, well-located on quiet street in St Germain des près with delicious breakfast in lovely courtyard”
Reviews.Author: anner85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights in July (2 adults, 2 kids age 11 and 14). Lovely, small hotel on a quiet street, walking distance to excellent restaurants. We had the appartment for 1 night (2 bdrm, 2bath with connecting corridor) and 2 separate rooms (deluxe and regular) the second night. We actually preferred having 2 rooms even though they were a little smaller, as the parents had more privacy (kids across hall).Luxurious all carrera marble bath and shower, nightly turndown and towel refresh. Breakfast in the exterior courtyard was a real treat - croissants and other goodies from local pastry shop - superb coffee and chocolat chaudStaff very helpful.We will return without the kids, too!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: hobbes013
Reviews.Content: ...in the end they charged us 77 Euro per night for the baby cot for our 11 month old daughter. I think that is just unbelievable and unacceptable not only in terms of value but also in terms of service. Everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “cozy, peaceful and quiet”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiginny
Reviews.Content: We stayed (husband and I) 6 nights and had 6 great nights of sleep...no noise at all. Our room was tiny, two twin beds but they were very comfortable and the sheets were really nice too. We did not have a stand up shower however and I thought we did, I wish that had been spelled out in my reservation. The morning breakfast was just croissants and other breads and rolls with jams, coffee/tea and juice. It's in a great location, with a metro stop just around the corner (St. Sulpice) or a short walk (Rue Rennes). Courtyard at night serves drinks and is very peaceful and romantic. The AC in the room worked well. The internet access isn't great, you have to sign up your own computer with your own password. It didn't work to well for me.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de l'Abbaye was everything and more we had hoped it would be.”
Reviews.Author: clbb
Reviews.Content: There is nothing negative about this hotel. The place was beautiful and in a fantastic location. The staff was amazing. Everyone was very warm, welcoming and helpful with all of our questions. The Courtyard staff serving breakfast every morning were all gracious. The hotel was furnished beautifully and had a very peaceful, calming feel to it. We had a duplex, terrace suite with 1 1/2 baths and it had plenty of storage space and more than enough room for 2 people. Thank you to Lionel and everyone at the Hotel de l'Abbaye for making us part of their "family." We cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “a very fine, quiet, pretty hotel with a charming, helpful staff night and day.”
Reviews.Author: acj76
Reviews.Content: We recommend the hotel highly. We met up there with friends who had stayed there before. We all were glad to be staying at l'Abbaye. It is less than two blocks from the Metro station S. Sulpice. There are a couple of nearby cafes and one restaurant on the corner of the block. The location that keeps it so nice and quiet also means it is another few blocks to walk to the neighborhoods which are more densely packed with restaurants and shops. Continental breakfast was perfect. They are also able to serve small meals seemingly throughout the day. We often came back at night for an Armagnac or tissane in one of the nicely decorated lounges. (The only negative that comes to mind is that our room had a tub with shower hose and no enclosure. As we get older, we'll need stand-up showers.)

Reviews.Title: “lovely oasis”
Reviews.Author: Buzzie7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days at the Hotel de L'Abbaye Saint-Germain. What a charming place in a wonderful area of Paris. It is near so many great restaurants and shops as well as easy access to the metro. So well located but just enough away from the action to provide a bit of peace after a busy day of sightseeing. Take the time to enjoy its garden for a coffee or drink or even a bite to eat. Breakfast in the garden was delicious as well. The staff could not be more kind, patient and more helpful. They did all they could to make us feel welcome and at home in such a special place. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: crdaus
Reviews.Content: L’Abbaye was rated at 8 of 1841 hotels in Paris when I stayed there which does not say much for the other 1833 hotels. I just don’t understand what drives tourism economics in France that they think they can charge so highly for sub-standard accommodation. At 260E per night I would have expected a bed more than 6 foot long, some bottled water, a proper shower – not a hand held shower over a tiny bath with no shower screen, a breakfast that included more than a thimble of juice, coffee and croissants, access to a gym, toiletries replenished daily, etc. Sadly, all these were lacking when I stayed there. On the other hand the hotel does have free wireless internet included although, as another reviewer has noted, it is not user friendly. And being able to open the windows for fresh air is a plus even if this means exposing the room to the inevitable noise which comes with living in the high density Parisian inner city. L’Abbaye would probably suit deaf little old ladies who like chintzy furnishings and who feel comfortable in claustrophobic surroundings. I do like the breakfast area situated in a glass atrium facing a lush garden. It was just a pity that the included breakfast was so meagre – surely some French cheese to have with that renowned French bread would not have been too much to ask, and some fruit? These “extras” were available, of course, but at ridiculous prices and of mediocre quality, especially the cooked eggs. The service was variable with the reception staff always being warm and friendly, but the breakfast room staff being quite slow. At one breakfast my waiter actually coughed over the place settings as he plonked them on the table with indifference. And a two person elevator in a refurbished building – what can the French be thinking? The location of the hotel is not bad – only 5 minutes walk from my favourite Parisian store: La Bon Marche, and 30+ minute walk down Rue de Rennes and Rue Bonaparte to a bridge across the Seine to the Louvre. Alternatively, the Saint Sulspice metro stop is only around the corner, but several train changes may be required to reach typical tourist destinations and the Paris metro can be difficult to navigate. If you need to travel to/from CDG do yourself a favour and catch the metro from CDG to St Michel and then change for St Sulpice – often a direct service taking about 30 minutes and cost 8.5 euro one way. L’Abbaye rates itself at 4 stars and certainly the prices are 4 star, but in my view it is 3 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “A calm respite in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mewsic
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite nice: classic (rather than trendy) decor; up-to-date, well lit bathrooms with enough room to store toiletries, etc; rooms--even the smallest ones--are a good size for this type of hotel and nicely furnished; air conditioning. The beds could use thicker mattress pads, though, and I prefer a single double bed to pushed-together-twin beds. But the latter wasn't a big deal and I may have forgotten to mention it when booking. The whole hotel is lovely, very clean, and perfectly maintained. The lobby is the best I've seen in Paris. There are several sitting rooms, a small glassed-in room that looks out onto a small garden, and seating in the garden, too. Breakfast is offered as well as light fare and drinks throughout the day. But what makes this hotel exceptional is the service--everyone from the housekeepers to the front desk staff is dedicated to providing professional, personal service. This is the kind of place where they know your name. They were always helpful with whatever I asked. Be sure to ask them for restaurant recommendations. They have always suggested good ones. This was the second time I've stayed at this hotel and it remains my #1 or #2 favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dogchow2
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Nice public areas. Clean as can be. The staff was as nice and accomadating as anywhere I have ever stayed. Rooms are a little small which is the only thing which was not excellant,. Even though they were small the rooms were decorated beautifully, well furnished and in great condition. You can probaly pay more and get a bigger, but not nicer room, with a staff not as good.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: liv999
Reviews.Content: quiet and peaceful hotel with attentive and friendly staff, room and bathroom clean and very comfortable. will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Jr suite 42”
Reviews.Author: spurg
Reviews.Content: We stayed flor two nights in room forty two on the top floor with twin windows looking on to the back courtyard. Very peaceful. Great neighborhood with access to luxembourg gardens if you are a jogger, tennis palyer, bocci ball, chess, or you want to see the Medici fountain. Hotel is very fresh and new and the wood makes it feel like a boat. The rooms on the top floor have cool skylights in the bathrooms. Free Internet is spotty with the iPad as you must continually sign on at each session and build a new account each time. The continental breakfast is served until noon so sleep in and then have it delivered to your room at no extra charge! There is no parking. We loved the local restaurant La Maison du jar din. Jr duties meaure about 360 square feet. Not huge but that is nice by Paris standards. Lift can only hold 2 people. The author of slum dog millionaire was being interviewed in the garden during our stay. What a windbag. Great hotel. Book early as it is popular with all the great shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “I have never stayed in a hotel that i loved better than this.”
Reviews.Author: CarolJ53082
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel de l'Abbaye for my birthday week. The staff warmly greeted us and always showed us the greatest respect. The duplex apartment was on two floors and decorated with exquisite French taste. The bathroom was spacious and the bedroom - two twins - allowing us plenty of closet and drawer space. Anything we wanted was graciously brought to our door. The entrance is spectacular, the area like a neighborhood with lovely shops and fun restaurants. Each night we had quiet rest, and in the mornings we were served a continental breakfast. Attention to detail is their forte, and I left feeling as if I were leaving my home. You will never find a better place to stay in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “very best in paris”
Reviews.Author: bibipino
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading many good reviews and expected pretty high quality but actually it exceeded our expectation! Staff was very helpful and the room was always clean, simple but wonderful breakfast was my favorite too... and importantly to us, it was spacey enough! We had 2 big luggage and bought plenty of things (some were pretty big like chairs, stools...) and had to pack and send them by sea, and we had no difficulty in packaging them in 2 big cartons. They were very helpful to keep them as left luggage and hand it to transporter when we were away. We stayed at other 4stars in Paris but Hotel de l'abbaye was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkably consistent quality over the years!”
Reviews.Author: Frugal-Bear
Reviews.Content: The date of our stay that I've supplied is, in fact, untrue. The real date was May-June 1981. My wife and I were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary with a trip to France, and stayed comfortably in this hotel for two weeks, part of it before and part of it after two other weeks we spent driving around France outside Paris. I'm reviewing the hotel only to say that the management must have been remarkably consistent over the years, because I began to read reviews of recent visitors and found that they ring true with the experience we had twenty-nine years ago. Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Germain plainly remains very good value for the money--though the money is a great deal more now than it was then!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, elegant and intimate - a great position to explore Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Lynni D
Reviews.Content: Loved this intimate, elegant hotel! We arrived early after long flight from Sydney - too early to check in, but intending to leave the luggage and venture out. We were warmly welcomed and offered a delicious breakfast - fresh fruit juice, baquette, croissants and freshly brewed coffee (or the best hot chocolate I've ever tasted). This was served in the conservatory overlooking the garden and the original walls of the ancient Abbey. The lounge and dining areas are decorated in florals, velvets, chintze with antique furniture and paintings - bowls of fresh flowers everywhere - elegant but not 'stuffy'. Spotless and well maintained. The bedroom had narrow french doors opening onto the front courtyard allowing fresh air to flow into the room as it was very well heated! The bed and pillows were very comfortable -floral linen covers and curtains - there was a safe and cupboards if required.The bathroom was spotless - white tiles - good quality white towels and lovely bath products. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great position - easy walking past boutiques, antique book shops and wonderful chocolate shops to the Seine - the Louvre and Notre Dame and quite near to The Luxembourg Gardens - a must to visit! The area is perfect - a great mix of cafes and shops. There is a stylish cafe on the corner next to the hotel - serving gourmet pizzas, interesting salads and the best pannacotta! - had couple of delicious meals there. Also, around the corner and just along the street from the Pizza Cafe is the most amazing patisserie and boulangerie. Customers were lining up outside! All in all, I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “An exquisite hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: rightsgirl
Reviews.Content: We adored this hotel. Very clean and the staff is welcoming and helpful. The breakfast room is a perfect start to the day . Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in hotel de charm in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Dominique050
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms albeit not very big in a charming hotel with very attentive service and a great location

Reviews.Title: “Tiny yes, but perfect”
Reviews.Author: stepstra
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five days last week at de l'Abbaye. We stayed here upon the recommendation of a friend who has lived in Paris for the past 20 years. I can only concur with the previous reviews. Yes, it is pricey at $320 per night for a tiny room, but everything was done to perfection. We had a corner room overlooking the courtyard, kept the window cracked open at night, all was quiet yet we could wake to the flocks of birds chirping each morning. The room was bright and cheery, the furnishings were tasteful, the thread count of the sheets was as high as it gets, the curtains were of high quality silk with ingrained blackout materials, and surprisingly all our luggage and clothes were neatly stowed away in the three tiny closets. In fact, tiny as it was, we have never been more comfortable and at home in a hotel room. The wireless worked well and the flat panel t.v. had a variety of international channels. Breakfast was simple, but again first rate: freshly squeezed juice, a variety bread basket of crackling fresh sourdough and croissants, and excellent coffee. I never would have believed that I would be so satisfied with what the French term a 4* hotel (1/3 less in size than normal international standard). As also noted by previous reviewers, the staff were indeed great – they treated one as family, with bemused delight, speaking in a French/English at just the right combination to give one the French experience without being lost. If money is not an issue, you cannot go wrong with de l'Abbaye.

Reviews.Title: “A special place!”
Reviews.Author: fido0
Reviews.Content: We took our family for a birthday celebration and stayed in this hotel. lt is in a lovely quiet street set back from the road and we had a wonderful suite with windows on to the inner courtyard. Our children had two bedrooms which were small but nicely decorated with twin beds and bathrooms. The service was excellent with charming and helpful staff who spoke good english and the breakfast was delicious with fresh orange juice, a basket of fresh bread and croissant and coffee/chocolate/tea to drink. The air conditioning was not switched on so we all slept with our windows open and for us it was fine but our family in the twin bedded rooms were overlooking the entrance of the hotel and by the stairs and they heard people arriving and wheeling their cases over the pebbles so they didnt find it that quiet. l would definitely recommend this hotel as we all would go back to it just maybe not in rooms overlooking the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of tranquility in the centre of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: CheshireGaffer
Reviews.Content: Really well situated for all the main attractions but in a quiet street which made for a really tranquil base between sightseeing expeditions. One of the things which impressed me was the friendliness of every staff member. They all had a smile and gave the impression that nothing was too much trouble. I would certainly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It's nice, but it's not 4*”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located nicely in St. Germain, but I do not find that it's truly 4* and is a bit overrated in my opinion. Yes. The hotel does have the courtyard entryway and various sitting rooms plus the famous garden. However, I truly preferred 3* hotels that cost considerably less for either the same or better amenities and services. The standard room (#29) that I got faced the courtyard. It is indeed small, however, it is liveable for one person. For two people it may feel closed in although the Verneuil's standard rooms are even smaller. I read reports about the tranquility, however, there is foot noise on the stone courtyard that can be heard in the room as well as the walls are thin, and the room is bang on the hallway so noise from the stairs and elevator can be heard. The bathroom is small but marble and lovely. For a 4* hotel I do not understand the lack of a minibar and the tiny almost useless hairdryer. As for the service the desk clerks are all right. I would say they do their jobs efficiently but nothing outstanding to set them apart from other hotels in lower categories. Some of the busboys are very attentive, and they are unique. There is a free terminal and guests may use the printer, however, as the printer is not separate do be sure you check before printing. In short, the hotel is quite pricey even with continental breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed in St. Germaine...”
Reviews.Author: hellojello123
Reviews.Content: It is wonderful. The bed quality == mediocre. Service, Location , Breakfast == Excellent!! Quiet refuge in a bustling city.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: londonpr
Reviews.Content: Just back from a trip to Paris and stay at L'Abbaye with my neice. It was a cold week and the hotel provided welcome refuge. First impressions were excellent; we were welcomed warmly by the staff and found the hotel's communal spaces very cozy and inviting. Fireplace in the sitting room was more than decorative, and while we couldn't enjoy breakfast in the garden, the conservatory was a great 'next best thing'. As others have said, the small rooms are typical of Paris. But the small built in wardrobes -- one for each of us -- were handy and made it easy for us to keep our room reasonably tidy. (no small feat for my teenage niece). Bathroom big enough and nicely done with a great shower. We liked the girly feel of the decor. Breakfast was excellent 'continental', and was included in the price we paid for our room. I can't say if this is the best hotel for the money, but it was certainly better than any of the other Paris hotels I've stayed at over the years. I''ve often been amazed at how unfriendly staff can be in big city hotels -- but not here -- very nice indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff,great location.”
Reviews.Author: marysToronto
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at L'Abbaye Saint - Germain for 5 days in February 2010. The staff were most helpful with directions and reservations at local restaurants. The rooms were excellent and the bathroom in our junior suite couldn't have been better. The hotel is spotless and in a safe area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry to leave.”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly031
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in perfect harmony with the exquisite hospitality of the staff of this hotel , the bedrooms are beautiful and well decorated , we could not have better central location, we conserve a good memory of this holiday and wil come back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, cozy, quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: rosiemchicago
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel tucked behind a courtyard in a quiet street very close to the St. Sulpice metro stop. The staff is very attentive and friendly. They gave us some good recommendations for nearby restaurants. A lovely continental breakfast was included and could be served at any time in our room--helpful with a late-sleeping teenager. Proximity to the metro was a plus, and the neighborhood is lovely. Only minus is that the room was a bit overheated and I couldn't seem to get the temperature adjusted. The decor and furnishings were attractive, and the bath was very modern and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “The Paris ambiance reflected in one room”
Reviews.Author: thefelice
Reviews.Content: Great location. Quiet place. Excelent junior suite. Friendly and always available staff making this stay an unforgettable Paris experience.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellouse”
Reviews.Author: kikioMilan
Reviews.Content: Exellent service, great space for relax in the romantic side of Paris The rive gauche of Paris St. Germain, the oldest church of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little gem in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: hobby_hotel_buff
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, relaxed atmosphere, courteous and helpful staff. A wonderful three night stay over New Year with great breakfast arrangements. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the heart of Paris minutes away from wonderful sights”
Reviews.Author: Brigid09
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay at this hotel and I would recommend. It is very quiet and within minutes of very beautiful sites. The staff are extremely nice and all speak fluent English. It was beautifully decorated for Christmas and felt like a wonderful place to come back to at the end of the day. I am sure we will be back there again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel with friendly, helpful staff in great location”
Reviews.Author: swrtzmk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Hotel L'Abbaye. It is a beautiful little gem on a quiet narrow street . The staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants and in suggesting the best way to get to various locations in the city. We had a classic room and though it was small, it was very pleasant with a large window looking out on the beautiful courtyard. If you cannot get in and out of a tub, though, I would suggest upgrading to a larger room with a regular shower. The included continental breakfast was a delight every morning. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for an intimite boutique hotel, this is it!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Deprived
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quiet and elegant. The sunroom is unbelievably beautiful, even when it is raining. There's a garden in the courtyard that makes the hotel feel like a secret hideaway in the city. This was my third stay at the L'Abbaye and I don't plan on staying anaywhere else when visiting Paris in the future. This is NOT the hotel for the party crowd or those traveling with a large group. The lobby and breakfast room are quite small and intimite. However, if you are with a friend, spouse, or small family, this is a lovely choice.

Reviews.Title: “The beautiful, cozy decor and friendly staff was absolutely perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Washington_DCLouise
Reviews.Content: Upon walking into the lobby, we were immediately pleased with the greetings we received. Once we saw our adorable room and the bathroom with towel warmer, we wished we had stayed there our entire visit in Paris. It was a great value, breakfast included, wifi included, quiet and a great location .

Reviews.Title: “beautifully appointed room and public areas.wonderfull staff”
Reviews.Author: magsenior
Reviews.Content: I would recomend this hotel both for location and for being exactly what you would expect in a hotel de charme.

Reviews.Title: “Inviting entrance and location, delicious breakfast and decor, lovely crowd and wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: schwabny
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. My second time there. Would recommend to everyone I know. It feels like walking into your own home, away from home. I felt very cared for, and very accommodated. It also feels and is very Parisian. It is not a hotel "pretending to be" Parisian. It is Parisian. The people working there care about making sure that you are getting the right advice for what it is that you want to do. Without me saying anything, they noticed how I slept in the bed, and made my bed each night, the blankets layered accordingly. My only suggestion: Even though it's not an official "restaurant" I loved the food, the bread, the hot coffee with cream. I found myself there in the evening by the fireplace meeting other happy guests. There were a few nights that I was hungry around 10pm but didn't want to go out, since the hotel was so cozy. They have hot soups, eggs, bread, and basic salads, but for dinner it can be hard. I suggested to them adding some cold plates to their menu, such as a vegetarian hummus platter. Other than that, I can't see why I would want to stay anywhere else. I could fly off from NY to Paris with a moment's notice, arrive at the Hotel L'Abbaye, and feel like I was in my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you can afford it!”
Reviews.Author: MonkeynutsToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Paris 3 times and this is by far the best hotel experience we've had. Rooms are large (for Paris); staff is incredibly friendly and helpful; the ground floor of the hotel smells lovely and is a great place to sit down for breakfast or a hot chocolate in front of the fireplace. Our room cost us a little less than double what we paid in the past at other inferior Paris hotels, but the experience was far better than twice as good. Location is perfect. We will definitely go back to L'Abbaye the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MBMBtravel
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for a combination business/vacation trip. I traveled with my wife, and it was our first time in Paris. We stayed in the Deluxe room #34. I think the other reviews of this hotel give a fantastic impression of the place. I have traveled for business quite a bit, and am used to the fact that the pictures of a hotel rarely give a "realistic" impression when you arrive. I am happy to say that is just not the case for the Hotel l'Abbaye. The hotel truly does look as beautiful as the pictures. The staff was friendly, attentive, and near perfect. Breakfast each morning was served downstairs (or in your room if you desire) in the most beautiful little garden. In November, it was too cold to eat outside, but the hotel has a glass enclosed salon so you are still sitting in the garden nice and warm. I was very concerned about the location of the hotel and its proximity to things we wanted to see. My concerns were unfounded, as the location was perfect. 3 blocks from San Sulpice metro station. 5 blocks from Rennes (on a different line). 1.5 blocks from the most AMAZING pastry shop we found in Paris (at the corner of Rue de Rennes and Rue de Mezieres). 1/2 mile from the Louvre. 3/4 mile from Notre Dame. A continental breakfast is included in your room price (coffee or tea and fresh breads). Other items are available for a small additional charge. The most common thing we added to breakfast was some fruit. One of our nights at the hotel was the night the Beaujolais Nouveau was released. The hotel held a reception downstairs with free wine, cheese, and hams. They also left us a bottle of Beaujolais in our room. We are fans of this wine, and this was a very nice touch. Recommendations for places to eat within walking distance: Louise Cafe Le Petite Cour Le Petite Zinc And that FABULOUS pastry shop listed above.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: DCTeach
Reviews.Content: We were surprised by how expensive the room was for how modestly-sized it was, but that may just be Paris. Nice hotel in a good location -- very close to the metro and a great boulanger. Lovely breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Words cannot describe the excellence here.”
Reviews.Author: Kelly1024
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just went for our honeymoon. It was beyond amazing. Upon arrival they had our room set up with Champagne and snacks. Our room (Deluxe #14) was phenomenal. I've traveled in Europe and the space was excellent. It had a king sized of 2 twins, a desk, a settee, his and her closets and a huge bathroom with a seperate tub and shower. The staff was the friendliest and most helpful that we've ever had. They truely made our stay a wonderful experience. The breakfast inclusion is also amazing. I would highly recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good value in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Bampi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exactly what you expect, clean, friendly with excellent service. Why they can't put up a shower curtain over the bath tub is beyond my comprehension, especially since so many of the guests are Americans. It would be a good value if the dollar were not so weak (November 2009). It is close to most of the good sights and tons of restaurants on the Left Bank.

Reviews.Title: “charming, quiet hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lapuli
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Paris and was given the name of the hotel by a a friend who has been there many times The decor was charming, the staff was friendly and helpful, and it was located within walking distance to everything. My wife and I loved the hotel and would definitely stay there the next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and gracious...”
Reviews.Author: Grace1219
Reviews.Content: Having just completed a Rick Steves tour where all my hotel stays were rather pedestrian, I couldn't stop smiling once I checked in. Three nights of bliss; crisp sheets, fluffy pillows, delightful rooms, and modern baths were a welcome tonic for this weary traveler. Desk staff and waiters could not have been more accommodating or genuinely helpful. They have earned my loyalty, and I will return to Paris and stay here again. Considering how rude the French can be, returning to this hotel after a day of sightseeing to welcoming smiles and gracious service was definitely a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, beautifully decorated, friendly and helpful staff -great place to stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: DoctorSNewJersey
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Hotel de l'Abbaye, but it will not be our last! This is a beautiful, quiet, immaculately clean hotel in a great location with a staff that is unfailingly pleasant and helpful. The standard rooms, while somewhat small, are charmingly decorated and the beds are very comfortable. The ground floor consists of several rooms which are filled with comfortable chairs and couches and are delightful places to have coffee or drinks or to visit with friends. There is a lovely garden as well as a pretty room with tables and chairs for breakfast. The continental breakfast, which was included in our room price, was fresh and tasty - my only suggestion is that it would be nice to have some fruit included in the breakfast. The location is excellent - right near St. Sulpice and the Luxembourg Gardens and in the fabulous St. Germain area. The Metro is nearby but we like to walk in Paris and the location means that most major attractions are (at most) within a 30-45 minute walk. There is great shopping in the area and an abundance of little restaurants. We never felt uncomfortable walking at night and often got back to the hotel after midnight. This is a great place to stay in Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “THE PERFECT HOTEL STAY”
Reviews.Author: carolina072
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay was wonderful. I arrived very tired and jet lagged. Everything I needed and wanted was provided with friendliness and competence whenever I would ask. The ambience made me feel comfortable and special. Have all your breakfasts there and rely on the most knowledgeable concierge for helpful advice. I will certainly recommend this hotel and hope to return very soon. Thank you, CAROLE FLAXMAN USA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in St Germain des Pres”
Reviews.Author: rhoya
Reviews.Content: Hotel de l'Abbaye is a very good, comfortable and stylish small hotel in an excellent quiet location in the 6th Arrondisement. The staff is uniformly helpful and friendly, and the quality of service is a major reason why we would return without hesitation. While the hotel does not have a restaurant, the included continental breakfast is first-class, and the available food and drink service, while limited, is very good. A wide range of good to excellent restaurants are nearby, and most major tourist sites are either within walking distance or easily accessible via the Metro. The standard room is a little small by American standards but very nice, with a good-sized (in our experience) bathroom. Our stay at Hotel de l'Abbaye met or exceeded all of our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: kpvolk
Reviews.Content: Breakfast capacity is too small - we had to wait for a free table almost every day!

Reviews.Title: “Great as advertized”
Reviews.Author: DrBob5
Reviews.Content: What a great experience on the left bank. Don't miss Chez Groumond a short walk from the hotel for an authentic dinner. The room we had was small but fuctional. Very clean and breakfast was a perfect easy start to a day in Paris. Don't miss.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, perfect French hotel to call home! LOVED it”
Reviews.Author: ElaineLG
Reviews.Content: Our stay for 4 nights at Hotel de l'Abbaye was absolutely amazing. From the moment we arrived, the staff was pleasant, helpful, gracious, and calming. Our bags were whisked away while we were taken up to our perfectly quaint, clean, lovely room. The bed was like a firm feathertop with plenty of comfy pillows & extra soft blankets & pillows in the closets as well. bathroom was very spacious, immaculately cleaned twice a day. The included breakfast was wondeful, and we took advantage of the all-windowed lanai with tables that looked out to the back courtyard. Very unhurried breakfast, again pleasant and overly helpful staff. Fresh-squeezed OJ, good coffee, a varied assortment of croissants etc and daily newspapers in a variety of laguages just right to start your day. One night we had purchased champagne from a cellar visit & not only did they chill it for us, but later that night offered to set us up outside in the courtyard to enjoy the bottle. We took them up on it and a server promptly took us outside & brought the bottle, complete with a spread of snacks & poured it. Everyone was so sincerely nice & gentle and the hotel is small, so they know who the guests are. This is not a big faceless chain with a bustling front desk. They say the metro is a 2 minute walk-- it is literally not even a block away & with 1 connection, we were able to access pretty much all the major spots. A second metro line is a couple blocks away as well. Within the neigborhood are some great restaurants, shopping, clean streets, nice upscale area. The hotel itself is 1 street behind the busy one, so you can easily keep the windows open without noise issues. St Germain is also in walking distance, about 15 min walk. Our stay was absolutely perfect, we didn't feel like we were in a hotel...it felt like home! (except where everyone takes care of you) We're already planning our next trip back & we'll definitely stay here again! I never wanted to leave!

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying in this beautiful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: angandtone
Reviews.Content: We loved staying in this beautiful hotel!!! This hotel might be rated four star but we enjoyed a five star stay! We would definitely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Best small hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: travelnut1945
Reviews.Content: We hesitate to say too many good things, for fear that our room won't be available next time we come.....Suffice it to say: Outstanding location, extremely helpful and cheerful staff, beautiful public spaces, excellent breakfast, and a wonderful room. Paris at its best.

Reviews.Title: “A most enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Oz2Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel is elegant and quiet. The staff are friendly and helpful and the close proximity to St. Sulpice Metro station made travelling around Paris very easy. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff - will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: CamillaCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: A hidden gem - originally we wanted to stay at the Bucci Hotel, but chose this after reading rewievs on the Internet. And we were so happy wechanged our mind. Situated in a quiet little street with great shops and restaurants near by. The hotel staff was so polite and friendly, breakfast was amazing and there atmosphere at the hotel is just so lovely. Would go back any time!

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: b0gey
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was extremly helpful and very polite with every request from check in to check out. Our room, though a bit small, was beautiful, clean and comfortable. the hotel was quiet every evening , also nice and close to the metro so it was easy to get around. This will be our hotel every time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasure stay”
Reviews.Author: pedroborba
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Calm, quiet, elegant. Not so luxurious, as any other in Paris, but a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Janice044
