Reviews.Content: A bit hard to find at first---Rue de Cassette is a tiny narrow street. The staff were very accommodating, and our room was just what we hoped for. We did have to wait a LONG time upon arrival for our room to be ready as we had arrived from the USA, but that was no one's fault. Complimentary continental breakfast was served in a pretty setting each morning--or rapidly delivered to your room. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: joiedevivre1
Reviews.Content: Perfect quiet location set back from the street. The common areas (several small rooms beautifully decorated) are lovely. Breakfast room is very pretty, especially when the glass partition opens to the private patio. What a plus that the tasty continental breakfast is included. Front desk staff was highly competent, extremely kind and very helpful with restaurant recommendations (good ones, not overly expensive) and reservations. Wait staff was also very kind an accommodating. Our only complaint is that the air conditioning in our room never cooled off the room sufficiently. It was approximately 80 degrees F overnight no matter how low we set the thermostat. Though we reported this each of the 3 mornings we were there and were told repeatedly that someone would check on it, no one did.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect getaway.”
Reviews.Author: PeKoz
Reviews.Content: We always stay here when in Paris, for the great location in the 6eme, the crisp service, the hidden garden, the quiet, and the sense of being taken care of at all times. L'Abbaye has everything you want in a small sophisticated city hotel. It is not big, modern, gadget-filled, or corporate. It is, instead, charming, discreet, and timeless.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolRockyroo
Reviews.Content: We just celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary in Paris and chose the Hotel de l'abbaye for our stay. It was a fantastic choice ! beautiful hotel with charming staff. We loved the hotel from the minute we arrived. The public areas and the rooms where very clean, the maid/staff should be commended. The garden was very romantic, candle lit tables. Very quiet and peaceful after a busy day sightseeing. Lovely to sit with a glass of champagne. 2 minutes from Saint Sulfice metro station, 10 minutes walk to the Seine. Lots of nice shops and restaurants within a few minutes. 5 minutes from Saint Germain Boulevard. Very well placed hotel. We where very sad to leave the hotel and will return with pleasure. Can say no more, words can't really describe the actual feel of this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: willisman
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to the hotel which has become our preferred base in Paris. The rooms are small but perfectly comfortable, and if you need more room book one of the larger rooms available. The staff are brilliant, always helpful and happy to impart their knowledge of what to do and where to eat. This is a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: zinha1
Reviews.Content: room was small but adequate. very clean and quiet. Staff exceptionally pleasant and helpful. Nice breakfast in lovely garden. Neighborhood interesting, close to subway and buses, close to Luxembourg Gardens and St.Germain. Nice restaurants in the area

Reviews.Title: “Charming service”
Reviews.Author: NG111
Reviews.Content: The staff were fantastic and made our stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Parisian "old style" hotel”
Reviews.Author: D_J_nearToronto
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for 5 nights and stayed two of them here. The hotel staff was extremely excellent and courteous at all times. The inner courtyard was beautiful, and the hotel, overall, a welcome respite from the bustle of Paris. Tip #1: make sure to ask the Bellhop how to work the TV, lights, AC, and key lock system as they can be difficult to figure out. Tip #2: yes it is very close to St. Sulpice metro station, but ask directions FROM the stop TO the hotel before you arrive: there were no less than 5 directions to choose from coming up from the Metro station. Hotel wise, the only improvement we would suggest is that the beds be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant boutique hotel away from the madding crowd!”
Reviews.Author: blesstheweather
Reviews.Content: A small yet perfectly formed hotel, sumptuously appointed and very welcoming. We were celebrating our silver wedding anniversary and had a second floor duplex which was beautiful. In fact the whole hotel offered a high quality, calm and relaxing atmosphere which we loved. The garden terrace is tranquil with the sound of a water fountain and chirruping sparrows. The hotel is close to many stylish shops and small restaurants as well as the dramatic (and now famous) St.Sulpice church, yet accessible for the Louvre and Notre Dame particularly. It was so nice to spend time in this area away from the general masses on the usual tourist trails.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeeBeeUsa
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Paris with our two daughters who just graduated from high school. After reading reviews of several Paris hotels on tripadvisor I decided to try to stay at the Hotel de l'Abbaye. It was a wonderful choice! I called directly to book two rooms. Mehdi, the gentleman who answered the phone, was very nice, cordial and helpful. I didn't book until late April for an early June trip so I was thankful they had two rooms available (I may have gotten the last two). This is an absolutely charming hotel in a terrific location. We had the "classic" rooms (standard) which were perfectly lovely and actually pretty spacious by European standards! Our two rooms were located across from each other, and then there was an "apartment" door that led to our little enclave. Very private, actually. We could have both bedroom doors open, while having the "apartment" door locked. Nice bathrooms and very pretty bedspreads and curtains. There are, I believe, more "deluxe" rooms available and four suites (duplex apartments) too, but we were very happy with our "classic rooms". Our daughters loved the hotel too! They have traveled a lot and are pretty discriminating-especially for 18 year olds! They, too, appreciated all the charm and service at the hotel. There is a lovely little courtyard in back, and we awoke to the sounds of a small fountain and birds every morning! Every member of the staff is a delight--we had breakfast each morning and coctails in the evening and were treated so well each and every day! If you want and appreciate a lovely, french hotel (not an American hotel located in France), this is the place! If you want an American style hotel with no charm, stay at a Marriott or Hyatt and save the rooms at Hotel l'Abbaye for those who appreciate all it has to offer. It is quaint, charming, has a great location in the St. Germain district, and has a wonderful staff. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Discreet, lovely and quiet hotel in St Germain”
Reviews.Author: PappysGirl
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel that was, traditionally speaking, "typically Parisian" in ambience and offered a feeling of luxury and service---without 5 star prices. This hotel provide all of this, plus the convenience of a location on a reasonably quiet street in St Germain very near shopping and good restaurants (not just touristy ones). I recommend staying here or at least in the neighborhood of St Germain, after having stayed in other neighborhoods. It is elegant yet still more relaxed to me than elsewhere and you will not be disappointed in Hotel de l'Abbaye. (If you stay here in warm weather, you will enjoy breakfast in a small, wonderfully peaceful courtyard with a fountain and birds chirping which will make you wonder if you are still in the City!) The staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly and the rooms clean, well appointed and the expected, smaller European size---but not cramped.

Reviews.Title: “The Service and Garden Ambiance Make Up for the Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Perijil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were only in Paris for one evening. The staff was very welcoming and helpful with our requests. Their recommendations for lunch and later for dinner were excellent. They directed us to an area within a 10 minute walk that had numerous quaint cafes and bars. There were very few tourists nearby, so bring your dictionary as our cafe was catering to English speakers - but welcomed us perfectly well. The garden and lobby are truly an oasis within Paris. I only wished we had a few more days to enjoy. Our room was quite small, but opened to the garden where we were awake to the sounds of birds chirping and the water fountain flowing. Very nice. I'd recommend booking the rooms online. They advertize a lower rate should you book directly.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, discreet, and gracious”
Reviews.Author: voyager1345
Reviews.Content: We had planned a trip with three generations of women but at the last minute my elderly mother was unable to come. With less than 24 hours notice, the hotel simply cancelled the room and, upon the arrival of my teenage daughter and I, one of the gentlemen at the desk inquired, "And how is your mother?" The staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. The lobby is distinctively and tastefully decorated, with several small rooms that allow for intimacy. Our room, while not large, included plenty of closet and drawer space, a vanity, and a lovely, up-to-date bath with both a tub and shower stall. Everything was spotless and attractively decorated. The beds are comfortable. We did have some difficulty with the a/c, which only works if the windows are fully closed and sometimes does not work even if the windows are closed. This was not really an issue for us, considering that it was quite cool for July. Although we were on the second floor (first floor, in French parlance), our room was completely quiet. Breakfast is included in the price and a limited room service menu is available. All the food and beverages were promptly provided and all was perfectly acceptable. We had no special requests, so we cannot really comment on the food. There is no restaurant. There is, however, a pleasant bar. Breakfast is served in the garden, which is a little gem, and, if it is cool or raining, part of it can be glassed in. The birds are a little too comfortable about grabbing their share of the food but that is not something for which one could criticize the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “At Home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: madden0327
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel - its staff is warm & friendly. The rooms are charming and the public rooms are beautiful. One feels as if they are at home in Paris. The garden area is a quiet oasis in the middle of the 6th arr. Area restaurants are plentiful and quite good. I would definitely return to Hotel de l'Abbaye St-Ger again.

Reviews.Title: “Very proper and clean”
Reviews.Author: du310try
Reviews.Content: Clean, quite, nice hotel in peaceful setting. Staff very helpful. Cont'l breakfast can be a little boring. Birds in open garden breakfast area get very aggressive (fly onto dinning tables) and staff treat it as normal. Activity quite on close-by streets but St. Germaine is busy district and easy to get around. Nice shops close by.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in most beautiful city in the world.”
Reviews.Author: DavefromSR
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, great people and service, fantastic visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisdun
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right off the metro on the left bank. Room was ready when we arrived around 1130. The garden is lovely and off the beaten track. One block and you are on the busy streets! The front desk was helpful with directions. Air conditioning was confusing but once the windows were shut the air kicked on (wish I had that at home)! Rooms were a little small but what do you expect in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: crimson7
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were small but comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful and spoke English. Location on Left Bank close to St Sulpice Church and metro station and a few blocks from St Germain area. Breakfast is typical French pastries, coffee and juice. Charming hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat in Paris”
Reviews.Author: travelizzie
Reviews.Content: We just spent a lovely four days. The staff could not have been more gracious and helpful. The room was very quiet,as the hotel is set in off the side street and we overlooked the front garden. Somehow we had two twin beds together instead of a double bed, and the tub had a hand-held shower spray which required a sit-down shower (this we knew about in advance), which were the only downsides. We did not really mind, however because the overall experience was so relaxing. The included continental breakfast (in the pretty rear garden) was just enough to hold until lunch: fresh squeezed orange juice, coffee and lovely breads. Hotel very convenient to several Metro lines, and within walking distance of many good restaurants, as well as museums including Rodin, d'Orsay, Louvre. The internet rate of 232 euro seemed quite fair. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The best nieghborhood in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: TomSonoma
Reviews.Content: The staff is awesome, this was my third stay. I am always thrilled with Hotel de l'Abbaye. The location is second to none, in my Left Bank (6e) opinion! The rooms are very comfortable, ask for full shower if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: jaaaarome
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Hotel de l'Abbaye after hearing about it on the New York Times blogposts. Given the prices in Paris, we figured why not pay a little extra and get a lot of extra value? Service was extraordinary. The room was clean, cozy, and comfortable. There is free WiFi in the hotel area. It is close to nearby Metro stations and reasonable walking distance to major attractions if you're fit. There was an elderly gentleman working most nights at the front desk who gave us great directions and advice about where to go and eat. He was very patient and knowledgeable. Breakfasts were included, and were excellent -- typical French fare. We will definitely stay there again the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: durhamhp
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel de L'Abbaye. All of the staff were gracious and accomodating. Not only were they willing and able to speak English with us (our French is not great), they were kind and offered to help with reservations and suggestions. We got several impromptu recommendations for restaurants in the area (Chez Fernand near St. Sulpice) and hard-to-snag reservations for a top notch restaurant for a special occasion dinner (Helene Darroze off nearby Rue d'Assas). The rooms were clean and comfortable with large bathrooms with shower/tub. The room had air conditioning, a flat-screen TV and 2 small closets. Importantly, it was quiet, with little to no noise from the outside, even if window was left open. Although the basic room was small, it was not uncomfortably small and larger than most basic hotel rooms in other metro areas (NYC or DC). The breakfast included each day was a nice coffee/tea and a basket of fresh breads/pastries. Delish! The courtyard where breakfast was held was beautiful! Overall, loved the Hotel de L'Abbaye and would recommend it highly! If we go back to Paris, that will be the first thing we book.

Reviews.Title: “charming gem in busy paris”
Reviews.Author: gorah123
Reviews.Content: Should really keep this one a secret. Chose a suite looking out on to the courtyard garden in this charming small hotel. Service is excellent and the rooms well appointed. We will return

Reviews.Title: “A truly charming stay”
Reviews.Author: ltdadd
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are small...this is Paris after all. My husband and I spent a few days here before leaving on the train for Avignon before our Viking River cruise and had a truly wonderful stay at this charming hotel. The central location let us go everywhere and after long hours of walking and exploring this was the perfect retreat. Their suggestions on the restaurant was fantastic. I do wish there had been instructions on how to use the phone...but all I had to do is ask. I would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: EstherD
Reviews.Content: After reading so many positive reviews about this hotel, I was very disappointed. The rooms were tiny, even for Parisian standards. the bathtub was too small to take a comfortable bath. The soaps and towels were all of low quality for a 4 star establishment. When asking how much it cost to call the US from our room, the receptionist said 30 cents a minute, but it came out to be 30 cents per pulse, which is a whole different price. One day when coming to the hotel room for a rest at about 4PM, the room was still not cleaned and the cleaning boy just started to clean it. The breakfast is very minimal; a croissant, a few pieces of baguette and jam; no fruit, no cheese, no eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy small hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: lcbNy
Reviews.Content: I just took my daughter to Paris for her college graduation gift and we wanted to stay in the 6th because I had lived there as a student many years ago. We came upon this hotel through Trip Advisor and a recommendation. We were thrilled with it! The room is small but not for Paris standards. The hotel is beautifully decorated, the staff was warm and friendly and very helpful. Paris was a kinder and gentler place for me and part of that was due to this hotel.Location, location. location!!!!!!!!! It could not have been better. We could walk everywhere and cafes restaurants and SHOPPING was perfect. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: bigredjohn
Reviews.Content: We spent eight nights here in May and June on my first trip to Paris. Paid about $230 Euros daily for standard room with continental breakfast and view of the courtyard. Had a very nice time. The hotel is very well-located, small and quiet, with smallish rooms and bathrooms, but in tip-top shape. Good continental breakfast. Air conditioning worked well, which was needed some nights. Public areas were extremely nice, staff and service were absolutely great. Computer with internet service was free. They could sure benefit from a better tub-shower, but I realize Europeans have some problem with shower curtains. Still, we consider this hotel a winner.

Reviews.Title: “We'll always say L'Abbaye is our favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MaryDallas09
Reviews.Content: The beauty of the hotel, the genuine warmth and caring of the staff and that little garden with the birds singing will always be one of our favorite memories of our romantic trip to France.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well located, quiet, everything you need for a few days in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: gangi
Reviews.Content: Charming, well located, 4 star hotel. Entire hotel is located on interior courtyards, so none of the rooms face the street, so all the rooms are quiet. Lobby and courtyard/garden in rear of hotel are very pretty. Free internet access via wireless in the rooms, plus a desktop off the lobby. Our room was very charming albeit small (about 12 sq meters), but very well laid out and serviceable with adequate closet space, good flat screen, etc; the bathroom was reasonably large in comparison. Very clean, good service. Service at the desk in the evening seems a little slower than during he day. Good quality croissant and coffee for breakfast, although not a full English breakfast that some others have begin offering in France. Would definitely stay here again if I was in Paris for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: zzzland
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 wonderful days at this hotel (and in Paris!) Being French (from Quebec) we had no language issues. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room overlooking the interior courtyard was smal by North-American standard, but who says that size matters? It was quiet, comfortable and elegant. This hotel was part of what made this trip one of our most memorable. The location is great. (We had picked this hotel after reading all the great reviews on this site and we were not disapointed!) We also had an idea of where we wanted to stay and the Saint-Germain-des-Pres district (6th arrondissement) fit the bill. It is in proximity of some of the major sites.There is a Metro station a few minutes away and another one maybe 10 minutes away in the opposite direction where you can take a different line. Visiting by Metro was the best way to see the city. There are over 300 stations! We also took the bus-very good transit system-- and the good thing about it was that you also got to see the sites while you travelled to your destination. Bottom line: This is a great hotel and we would stay there again in a hearbeat. (In fact we are planning another quick trip to Paris next year). BTW, I uploaded a lot of pictures of Paris on my website at the following address: http://www.freewebs.com/zzzland/

Reviews.Title: “Très Magnifique! What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KRT23
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. My husband and I stayed here during the New Year celebration for the first 3 days of our honeymoon. We had been awake for 30 hours straight when we arrived in the rain; I was so tired I couldn't think of the correct French to check in! Luckily, the hotel staff easily completed the transaction in English, then whisked away our luggage while we enjoyed hot tea and cookies (it was all so wonderful I started crying; yes, I'm a tad emotional). The elevator was small by our standards, but quite large compared to the other Parisian hotel where we stayed (alas, we could not afford such luxury for more than three days). Our room was beautiful and the staff was extremely tolerant; we wouldn't normally stay in such an exquisite hotel in America, much less in Paris, so it was all very new to us! The hotel is right down the street from the famous Église Saint-Sulpice (under renovation during our visit); it's also very close to a couple of Métro stations, so it's very easy to access the rest of the city as well. We had a great first-night meal in a small bistro nearby (excellent Spaghetti au Saumon!).

Reviews.Title: “luxuriously simple”
Reviews.Author: Amelie24
Reviews.Content: The location is great, next to the metro station Saint-Suplice. There is a bakery in the same block and walking a few blocks there are great cafes, shops and restaurants. The atmosphere is cozy decorated in classic style. The cleaning is great and the service is very good. Everyone is very friendly and available to answer any questions of tourists who do not understand well the French language. Did not like the bathroom of the box that allows the bathroom floor is wet the bath. There is no minibar in the rooms. We go on our next trip and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: Redfoot
Reviews.Content: Good location, within walking distance, of fine restaurants and cafes in St-Germain-des-Pres, in the lively left bank.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful little hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DANNEW
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my friend to Paris May 7-10 2009 and I was tasked with finding the hotel. There are only about 1,500 to choose from! I was reading "Paris For Dummies" and the author rated this hotel as one of his favorites. So, I booked it! I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. STAFF: The staff was so friendly and courteous from the moment we walked in to the moment we checked out. ROOM: Our room was the "Classic Room". It was a medium sized room with charming linens and drapes. There were 2 twin sized beds pushed very close together but I still feel like we had ample room. We each had our own closet to hang our clothes and there was an additional closet with the safe and extra storage. The bathroom was fantastic - very modern and comfortable and with shelves to hold our toiletries. There was NOT an iron or ironing board - but the hotel does offer clothes pressing service. There was a hair dryer. AND, there is FREE WI-FI internet access which is a nice added bonus. FOOD: Our stay included breakfast which we ate outside in the wonderful garden. Our breakfast was coffee or tea, fresh squeezed blood orange juice, and an assortment of croissants and rolls with jams. LOCATION: the location is perfect! The St. Sulpice metro station is a block away - this was the cheapest and easiest way to get to Paris - this train takes you to the Chatelet stop in Paris which is a block or two away from the Seine. The hotel is also near the Jardins du Luxembourg which were absolutely beautiful. The area was a very nice, chic area of Paris. We felt very safe there as well. PRICE: our room cost us each approx $150 USD/night. It was well worth it - the hotel is so charming and exquisite and the location is just right. OVERALL: I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat - it was such a positive, wonderful experience. Our host, Midi (not sure how to spell his name was FANTASTIC. If anyone ever tells you that the French people are not nice, they are WRONG. Everyone at this hotel was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pbarnold
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short stay at the Hotel de l'Abbaye in Paris. What a wonderful place with helpful staff, cute breakfast area, and amazing charm. It is well located near the Luxembourg Gardens and the St. Sulpice metro stop. This is the place I will stay at every time I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: jennie21
Reviews.Content: The best i loved about the this hotel is that its natural surroundings. The room though small, was lovely and beautiful with a garden !! The staff is very great. It was a very friendly feel here.. truely french !! Sitting for breakfast in the conservatory felt good..

Reviews.Title: “Quiet with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaSuzy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in the Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Germain for 4 nights recently and we enjoyed everything except the shower. To the hotel's credit, they tried to fix it, and I'm sure they did the best they could, but it never really drained properly. I'm sure it's because of the "ancien" plumbing. The bathtub worked well however and was big and roomy. The hotel itself is lovely with a peaceful courtyard in the middle and everyone there was very friendly and helpful. When we left, we had left behind some articles which the hotel mailed to me here in the USA at their expense. Can't get better service than that. The room service was good but it would have been nice to have had more choices for lunch and dinner. Very basic menu of sandwiches and cheese and fruit plate, omelets, etc. Breakfast was delicious and could either be served in your room or downstairs by the courtyard listening to the birds. The location of the hotel is great with shops, restaurants, and pharmacies nearby. One other thing though, we turned the thermostat down to the lowest setting but it never really did get cool enough (for me anyway!) I like it really cool especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “service was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: sherrykBoston
Reviews.Content: The concierge was incredibly helpful: He made our dinner reservations for us, offered us breakfast when we arrived from our overnight flight; and helped me improve my french at my request: Our room was spotless, and we had a small private garden: Do not expect a chain hotel; you will hear the plumbing and people outside at night But you will also hear the birds and feel the fresh air through your huge windows. It was charming!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: packNyc
Reviews.Content: Just what we wanted. A very French hotel in Paris. Small - 47 rooms. Breakfast in the small garden or in the sunny breakfast room. Walk to sites in the 6th, 7th, 5th, 1st. Staff was helpful with restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KesslerPark01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de l'Abbaye for a quick getaway without our kids. It was wonderful. We had a junior suite, which is admittedly slightly expensive, but it was a great room. Very comfortable and free wireless internet. The breakfasts in the morning were fabulous and we enjoyed having a couple glasses of wine in the afternoon in the lobby/atrium. We also liked the location -- about 30 seconds from the Saint Sulpice metro stop (about 5 minutes from the Luxembourg RER stop), and about 10-15 minutes from all the sights on the Seine. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone traveling to Paris and hope to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “The most exquisite boutique hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: nytravelgurl
Reviews.Content: The hotel and garden was a fabulous retreat from the hustle of city. Each morning we awoke to the music of the birds, and enjoyed a delicious breakfast. We returned in the evening to a romantically lit hotel, with a warming fireplace and enjoyed drinks in the lounge or outside in the garden. The staff was so friendly and accomodating. Especially Denis, who offered many wonderful local tips and made us feel like royalty every day of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, sophisticated, enjoyable, very warm and exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: PamThompson13
Reviews.Content: We were exhaused from our istanbul trip and needed the perfect place to spend the night before returning to the US, and Hotel de l'Abbaye was it. The room could have been a bit larger, but everything else was pretty, comfortable, enjoyable and fun. The staff was terrific, and other guests were interesting an.d just like friends at thome. Our batteries were recharged.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and decor”
Reviews.Author: dnjhowell
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and common areas create a wonderful private setting with great convenience to shopping, St. Germain, the Latin Quarter and Metro service.

Reviews.Title: “A restful haven in the heart of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Musicvoyager
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de L'Abbaye was our favorite part of Paris, which is saying a lot. From the moment we arrived, jetlagged after a long flight, the hotel was a refuge of peace and hospitality. We loved the breakfasts in the tranquil conservatory and appreciated the kindness of Mehmet, who served us every morning. The hotel was centrally located for walking to the sights that we particularly wanted to see and for the evening concerts we attended (if you like classical music, a concert at Sainte Chapelle is not to be missed). We requested and were given a room overlooking the back garden, and I enjoyed having a cup of tea there in the evenings after returning to the hotel. Altogether a magical experience!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in my favorite part of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: amoveablefeast2009
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de L'abbaye is a charming and quiet small hotel in St. Germain within walking distance to St. Sulpice, Jardin du Luxembourg, Latin Quarter, shopping, museums, the metro and excellent dining experiences. It is pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, authentic Parisian experience”
Reviews.Author: Teri_Low
Reviews.Content: We will always try to stay in this wonderful hotel when we visit Paris. The hotel is quite small and has the feel of staying in the large home of Parisian acquaintances. Breakfast is offered daily, as late as you wish, in the parlor and patio, and guests take their time eating, reading and listening to the birds outside. All rooms are different, quite clean and well maintained. One must be comfortable finding the hotel, which is located off the main streets and not in the midst of one of the more touristy areas. As one of the kind hoteliers said, this is a hotel that appeals to those Americans who are already comfortable in Paris. We hope to return one day soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for restaurants, bars and more”
Reviews.Author: Bluetoo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful area exploring Paris...................................

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: FFC_RJ
Reviews.Content: It took me a while to come to Tripadvisor to write a review about this hotel. Shame on me, specially because I have chosen this hotel based on Tripadvisor's reviews. Honeymoon, Christmas and New Year's in Paris - add to that a fantastic hotel and you have the perfect trip. Expensive? Yes, but who said that Paris is cheap? If you are looking for a bargain, this is not the place. However, if you want the perfect service, a small luxury hotel and location at its best this is the place. We have stayed at the Junior Suite - gigantic for Parisian standards with a flawless decoration with fantastic pieces of furniture and some antiques. Clean and comfortable, with nice amenities and an invisible and efficiente service. From reservation to check-out, everything was perfect. If you want to indluge yourself a great time in Paris do not hesitate - go to the Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint Germain!

Reviews.Title: “WOW, What a gem! If your going to Paris, this is a must stay!”
Reviews.Author: Radman509
Reviews.Content: Ok, anyone can stay in a chain hotel, but you will never get chance to experience a Parisian gem like Hotel de l’Abbaye in Saint-Germain. If you blink, you may miss the entrance to the hotel, but what else is GPS for! My wife and I just took 10 days in Europe and one of the highlights was our stay at this hotel. We may not speak good French; however, the staff was more than accommodating from grabbing our bags from the vehicle until booking us another hotel in the Loire Valley region upon our departure… I can tell you I usually only write a review for poor performers, but I wouldn’t want to let the next family or couple looking for a hotel in Paris to pass on this one. Trip Advisor and the reviews of folks prior to our leaving were the reason we chose this hotel, so I would be remise not to recommend if you were reading this review. I read other reviews, so there is no need to add additional detail to the fantastic location, the wonderful continental breakfast and coffee, the lobby and of most importantly the staff. The one detail that I have not seen from past reviews is some of the room details. Yes, some of the rooms may be small relative to standard hotels, but very few offer the experience that this hotel offers. I am a frequent traveler and have stayed at some great hotels, but this delivered unlike any “typical hotel” can, unique charm. I RECOMMEND UPGRADING YOUR ROOM BY PICKING A COURTYARD GROUND LEVEL ACCESS IF YOU ARE ON A HONEYMOON OR ANY ROMANTIC GETAWAY. YOU WON’T BE DISSAPPOINTED. ENJOY, and I thank everyone for the past recommendations as we were not disappointed other than the “value.”

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Parisian Jewel”
Reviews.Author: namratak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a two night stay at the Abbaye, that we had planned for our fifth anniversary. We were floored by the hotel's elegant location on rue cassette, behind rue bonaparte in the 5th and 6th, around the corner from st germaine de pres and at st sulpice Metro stop. If you are going to Paris, I cant think of a better location. The hotel is a stones throw from elegant boutiques, restaurants and cafes but also central enough to be anywhere else fairly quickly and access Paris' main tourist attractions too. Given the poor service we have had in the past in paris, we are always a bit apprehensive. Walking into the hotel we immediately got a warm and effusive welcome in English by the smiling staff and were ushered into the conservatory/lounge to drink coffee and take breakfast, where there is a cozy fireplace, plenty of magazines and a very charming little bar. Everything was taken care of with warmth and smiles, which we appreciated. The hotel staff are very knowledgeable and can help advise you if its your first trip to Paris or your 50th.The room we were given was very small, but you are paying for lacation I suppose here. May well be worth looking into a next level up room- we had a classic ( lowest tier I suppose) room. The rooms themselves though small are immaculate with Fragonard toiletries, fresh towels and great sheets.The only issue we had with our room was the hand shower which made it difficult to shower quickly. Try to get a room overlooking the courtyard these are lovely-most of the rooms have French windows so you wake up to the sound of birds chirping, water trickling in the fountain of the courtyard below and the smell of fresh coffee thats being served in the garden below at breakfast. The room rate includes standard continental breakfast: as much cafe au lait as you can drink ( strong, good quality and very hot- one can always judge a hotel by the quality of coffee and toiletries) , fresh juice, fresh pastries and great french croissant. A hot breakfast in extra but is available. The best feature of the hotel is the lounge, and salon area which dobles as a bar in the evenings, and extends out to a glass conservatory in the mornings where they serve breakfast. This is not a hotel if you want a gym, business centre, coffee shop convenience type experience. Its nostalgic, stylish and very romantic!The area itself is around the corner from cafe flore and l'eglise de st germain, both Parisian landmarks.These are surrounded by a host of fantastic boutiques & cafes on Rue bonaparte, whilst candle, perfume, lingerie, chocolate and pastry shops abound: all gorgeous, but quite , ahem, expensive! be sure to take a terrasse outside the st germain church if you can or stop by for lunch at brasserie colombier which is just down the road near st sulpice M stop, both are very local hangouts. All things considered , we will definitely return to the Abbaye!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LikeToTravelTill100
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time I have stayed here and as usual, the service was great, the staff were helpful, and the whole hotel experience was wonderful. Location is very convenient to the Metro and neighborhood dining. Very restful and calm oasis in the fashionable are of the Left Bank.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice small hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Sinead_9
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here, the occassion a birthday, it could'nt have been better, its very pretty, the location is great and the staff were faultless. If I was staying there again I think it would be worth paying the bit extra to have a deluxe room, just for that bit extra space.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy atmosphere, nice team and decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: jclegey
Reviews.Content: Cozy environment, nice team and decent room. I am very well satisfied and willing to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden in the centre of Paris, you feel as if you are in the country.”
Reviews.Author: Dana19
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. Felt like being in the heart of the country. Lovely area for breakfast looking out on courtyard with fountain. Big fires and comfortable places to sit in lobby. Rooms good though not huge. Service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had known about l'Abbaye St. Germain sooner”
Reviews.Author: Zooeybear
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th trip to Paris having stayed at different hotels and an apartment each time -- the L;Abbaye was by far my favorite place to stay. My husband and I really enjoyed the fireplace in the lobby and the breakfast atrium was a perfect spot to start the day. Our room was a little larger than the average Paris 4star hotel (most hotel rooms in Paris are on the small side) and seemed to have been updated fairly recently. The bathroom was great! My husband is 6'4" so having the separate shower with a shower head that can accomodate his height was an added bonus. My favorite part was the service - we were greeted by name when we arrived the first day and the front desk staff was very helpful with some dinner reservations at a nearby restaurant with a great menu and full of local residents.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 1601Sweethearts
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a remarkable stay in Paris at the Hotel de l'Abbaye on Rue Cassette. This small boutique gem of a property is everything its website promises and MORE! I admit I was drawn in by its luxurious feel, combined with its historical significance as a former site of an abbey/monastery. The tour on the hotel's website is absolutely accurate, and if not for the different flowers in the vases throughout the property, I could submit my own photos and you would see they align perfectly. In fact, I am submitting mine so you can see there is no embellishment at all. I used email to ask questions, and the staff very promptly and professionally responded, assuring me of their competence and utmost warmth. Actually, I often travel to Italy because in part the people are so wonderful, but these folks were divine in every way. I booked the entire trip with a few emails and one phone call, and we were off to France two days later for a three day weekend. We were Mom and two daughters, ages 12 and 17. We stayed in the lovely classic room pictured, and had a rollaway bed brought to augment the sleeping arrangements. This cost an extra 76 Euros per day, declared clearly by the staff during my preparations, bringing the total to 308Euros per night for a three night special, including taxes and breakfasts for three each day. No surprises at all with my bill upon checkout. Voila! Fresh orchids daily, fresh aromatic blooms in the common areas, fresh flowers planted in the outdoor gardens (even though we had a bit of snow(!) Feb 2), warm wood fires, and delightful staff attended to our every need in an unobtrusive way. The bedding was first rate, our room was cleaned impeccably and often, and entirely discreetly. My girls loved the WiFi and used their iPod Touch for internet throughout the hotel (free) as well as a desktop available near the front desk to check in for flights. We enjoyed champagne and chocolates by the fire as I played cards with my 12 year old, and YUMMY breakfasts by the water fountains in the garden area with coffee as intense and indulgent as any in Italy. The staff sent us for local dining at Cafe Cassette steps away. We loved it and returned to this NON-tourist cafe. Though we speak only a bit of French, we got along with some Italian, some French and some English. Staff at the hotel was always entirely fluent in English. Walking in the 6th Arr. is safe, quaint, and filled with every shop three gals could manage in three days. We could walk 3 minutes to the museum Luxembourg, and cabs were around to go to Notre Dame, which cost only about 6 Euros. The Car Rouge open top on-off buses run from there, all around town. We took the 9:00 P.M. Cruise down the Seine (10 Euros per adult, half for kids) and were mesmerized by Paris at night! The stores are CLOSED SUNDAYS, which was a shock, but we entertained ourselves wonderfully at teatime at LADUREE at 21 Rue Bonaparte, just a ten minute walk from our hotel. We bought their world-renowned macaroons to take home, too, after nearly collapsing from pure bliss overload upon the first bite. Long lines, but worth every second for the bakery take-out. The tea-room upstairs was gorgeous. Overall, the Hotel de l'Abbaye was divine, made us feel pampered and cherished, and truly I hope that I can get a reservation again when I return to Paris. We are so grateful for a spectacular, safe, and luxurious weekend. Ooh La-la!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Shogan77
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed one night in this hotel, while we were in Paris. It was a long, tiring day, but from the moment we checked in our worries and stress disappeared. The staff were incredibly friendly. Especially the older gentleman at reception who was very funny. The hotel common areas are very comfortable, spacious and tastefully decorated. The open log fire is a nice touch. The rooms are very well designed (use of space etc) and also tastefully decorated. The attention to detail is particularly impressive. Rooms have a high quality boutique/bed&breakfast feel to them. Our complementary breakfast in bed was exactly right and delivered precisely on time. The view of the courtyard from our room was also very nice. The hotel is in a great location in St. Germain and set off a quiet street in a good neighborhood. There is a very nice cafe just down the street which serves good quality traditional cafe food (incl. Soupe a l'Oignon) late into the evening (we eat after 11 and it was still busy). Although not cheap, all in all I would say this is the best value for money hotel I have ever stayed in Paris and I will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimBWV
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 2 night stay at this hotel. The service was friendly and very helpful. Our room (Deluxe) was a good size (for Paris) with a great shower and a little terrace. The location is perfect for restaurants, shopping and site seeing. This is our 4th trip to Paris. We have never stayed at the same hotel twice but we will stay at Hotel L'Abbaye on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 'Hotel de Charm'”
Reviews.Author: Ajaxio
Reviews.Content: Hotel de L'Abbaye is a home away from home in Paris and a great value for the level of quality and service experienced. This charming hotel is in a wonderful neighborhood. Hotel staff will attend to your every need and are always warm, friendly and supremely helpful. Rooms are very clean, comfortable, stylishly decorated and well appointed. I have stayed here numerous times over the last 25 years and have always had a terrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favourite hotel on the Left Bank!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentBizTraveler9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first time for 3 nights in December, 2008. My wife and I visit Paris frequently and we almost exclusively stay on the Left Bank. We have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels either in the Latin Quarter or St Germain de Pres area. This hotel is in our view the best hotel for overall quality of room, location, service, and value for money. We stayed in a standard room which was typically small but pretty and clean. It was incredibly quiet. The only negative was the bed was a little uncomfortable, particularly the pillows. The location was outstanding near Le Bon Marche and St. Supulce. Service was great and friendly. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de L' Abbaye never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: MikeMalvern
Reviews.Content: Straff outstanding in their care, help and efficiency as usual. The public areas of the hotel are nost welcoming and comfortable; the log fire adds greatly to the ambience. Mike Smith

Reviews.Title: “great staff at the Hotel de l Abbaye”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTrr
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel The staff were so helpful and it could not have been a better stay . We have stayed in many hotels in Paris and this was the best. We loved all the little details including excellent breakfasts facing the garden terrace with English newspapers . The staff also gave us wonderful reccomendations for dining close to the hotel on Christmas day.

Reviews.Title: “not really kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: turley8
Reviews.Content: we booked two rooms for a family holiday with our two young children. rooms are clean and quaint, location is good, but a few problems we encountered: no mini fridges in the rooms. not sure if this is common all over paris, but for the price, we were a bit surprised at this. as last reviewer mentioned, they were STINGY. apart from the breakfast, which he mentioned, we had two rooms in total, paying over $1,600 on our accomodation in total and we got one bottle of Evian water on the first day each per room- it was never replenished. they also do not provide shampoo at the hotel either, only bath gel. its pretty rough on the hair! Stingy is okay when you are paying stingy for the rooms, but here not! and lastly, service incident to end our trip left a sour taste- we had already checked out and were killing time in the very parlour downstairs. i asked the receptionist if she could help warm up my kids milk for us. 15 min later, i knew the milk would be too hot for the kids to drink, so asked two different people to bring out the milk- no response- 5 people milling around reception, everyone seems too busy to bother with our milk. another 5 minutes later and the milk comes out, and as predicted too hot to even hold. lady said "ca va?" and i replied that it was too hot, she says in french," well, you'll just have to leave it out and wait then" ...turned on her heels and stormed off, clearly annoyed and not interested in helping me anymore to get my kids their milk. nice touch. all maybe normal for paris, but for the price, not exactly impressive... its redeeming quality is that there are two (and only two!) very very friendly and helpful staff at the hotel- too bad not everyone there is...

Reviews.Title: “Quite, clean and romantic”
Reviews.Author: Bul
Reviews.Content: After reading these reviews I booked a room in this hotel and spent with my wife 2 nights starting 12th December in this lovely hotel. The fact that it is so close to St. Germain and the beautiful boutiques and restaurants and all that live stuff but still is a quiet retreat was a big advantage. All the rest was already written by other users : the winter garden, wonderful decoration, fireplace, very friendly staff. We found even the price for standard room ok for Paris hotel rates. The room was quite big. The only missing thing is indeed the shower.... but who cares !! We will for sure come back to there for summer !

Reviews.Title: “too special”
Reviews.Author: d16rr702
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews, looked at the pictures, then booked a 3 night stay in a Superior room for my wife and I on the hotel website. About $450+/night. Wow, can't wait. Upon arrival, My first impression was that a lot of people put a lot of time, money and thought into this place. Drinks by the fireplace anyone? In Paris? with carpet, velvet couches surrounded by original sculpture and master paintings!? Very special indeed. Our room #2 was on the ground floor adjacent to the sitting / tv room. Thoughtful and clever designs throughout. Very comfy but non-supportive euro type bed. Fancy hot shower with no tub (which I prefer). Toilet was squeezed into a separate tiny closet, cool but tight for my long frame. Wonderful personal sitting/greenhouse with access to our own garden, awesome! All of this lead to great -you know what- on the first night and morning, 5-star fantastic. breakfast was simple but good, anything extra costs extra....why charge 5 euro for an omlette when you pay 100 times that per night? silly. Overall we liked our stay but the "$" vs. "the goods" don't make this above average for us. Better for rich older people....like the ones peering at us, while we were grinning at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katherine2Kelowna
Reviews.Content: The Hotel L'abbaye exceded our expectations. The staff were extremely gracious and helpful. The hotel was in a wonderful neighbourhood and everything was within walking distance. St. Germain is a great street to explore. PS; The hotel coffee was "exceptional"

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was fabulous...the hotel was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: mmarch
Reviews.Content: The Abbaye is a perfect hotel: everyone is extremely nice and helpful, the atmosphere is lovely, the rooms are very quiet and comfortable, the breakfasts are delicious. It is simple and not pretentious. It is everything one could ask for in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel de l"Abbaye”
Reviews.Author: eatswell
Reviews.Content: As usual, a gem of a hotel. The front desk staff in particular is excellent -- friendly, helpful and professional -- a real asset. Great location, near the Metro, bus lines, and, especially welcome, very good restaurants within walking distance. The addition of a varied menu for light meals and late-night snacks is a real plus. Why stay anywhere else? A bit expensive, but worth it to be well-taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I'll stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: VRoseWebb
Reviews.Content: We've now stayed at L'Abbaye 4 times, and I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris. The neighbourhood, St Germain de Pres, is fantastic, a nice walk to most places you want to see, with a lot of great shopping and restaurants within minutes. The hotel itself is really lovely and charming, tucked back in a quiet courtyard off the main street. We never wanted to leave the lobby/reception/bar area, with it's great conservatory that opens onto a beautiful little garden. The rooms are small - typical for Paris - but are beautifully decorated and very comfortable, with good size bathroom, closets, televistion. The service is absolutely impeccable. Everyone is friendly and you can tell they want you to feel at home and have a great time. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great ambiance, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: bongomoppet
Reviews.Content: charming hotel in a great location. Set on a quiet street, walk around the block to boutiques and restaurants. Very close to the metro station. Servce staff was very attentive. nice breakfast in the inner garden. My only complaint is...no shower in the standard room..and, I like showers! other than that, parfait!

Reviews.Title: “L'Abbaye Saint-Germain is excellent”
Reviews.Author: titanmusic
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed at the Hotel de l'Abbaye. This time we had a large room (room 2) which was quite spectacular. We had our own small conservatory and courtyard! The public areas in the hotel provide a lovely environment with a cosy fire-side area, an area with small tables where you can sit and eat. drink or just read, a lovely conservatory which is ideal for having breakfast and a picturesque garden area (where you can smoke!) The service is impeccable and non-intrusive. The hotel is spotlessly clean. There is no restaurant but there is a very good, if simple, snack menu which is served throughout the day. The staff are extremely polite and friendly. I have stayed in about 10 different hotels in Paris and this one is by far the best. Although it is not cheap (our room cost 350 EUR per night), you really do feel that you are getting value for money. The location is also excellent being close to Rue de Rennes, Montparnasse, Luxembourg and St Germain. We go to Paris once a year at least and have no plans to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Really cosy little place”
Reviews.Author: DippyFlip
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming and cosy hotel. Refurbished rooms are very good. Open fire and pretty courtyard create a very relaxing "house party feel". Service was charming but occasionally a little slow. Very good location within 2 minutes of the metro (St Sulpice) and a few minutes walk from the Luxembourg Gardens, Pantheon, St Germaine des Pres and Place St Sulpice. No restaurant but an abundance of good brasseries and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Tjosan
Reviews.Content: Due to the reviews oin Tripadvisor we chose this hotel for our 4-day stay in Paris.We arrived before the room was ready (checkin is 12.00 which anyway is quite early) but while waitng was served a coffee and croissant in the lobby. 12.15 we checked. Our room was somewhat small but in excellent shape. The hotel is just 50 m off the noisy streets but as soon as you enter it is quiet. We could sleep with our window open with no noise problem. How ofte do you find a quiet room in a major city. The breakfast room (Orangeri) with the beautiful garden is very nice. Due to an early flight we had to check-out before breakfast opened but the waiter arranged for us to have our breakfast 20 min before opening time. That warms. The hotel is located within walking distance to most of the "must-sees". Near Quartier Latin with its busy night life. We will stay here next time we go to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Gem of an hotel”
Reviews.Author: GMforever
Reviews.Content: Having spent half my life in Paris and half in North America, I have come to appreciate the best of the 2 worlds. Hotel de l Abbaye Saint-Germain did not disapointed me. The location is perfect, in St-Germain des Pres, close to the Luxembourg. It is also 5 minutes from the metro, on a direct line to go to La Gare du Nord ( Eurostar ) and easy connection to Charles De Gaulle airport. The hotel is in a courtyard, on a quiet street ( very difficult to find in Paris ). The decor is enchanting. You feel more like home that in an hotel. NIcely decorated salons with a fireplace, a small garden, a conservatory where you enjoy a wonderfull continental breakfast. The rooms are also gorgeous. We were lucky to have a little terrasse overlooking the patio. So romantic. The bathroom was gorgeous , more american than european in style . It was spotless. No carpet in the bathroom (which is pretty common in France). The staff is absolutely wonderfull, charming, warm, competent. Totally unlike the reputation some of the Parisians are known for ( and I used to be Parisian). My husband an I have travelled around but I think I is the first time I fell in love with an hotel. I hope we will be able to go back soon Again lovely place and wonderfull service

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Germain”
Reviews.Author: Lorei1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Germain exceeded my expectations. I travel extensively and always research Trip Advisor to review real experiences of travelers along with their pictures that truly reflect the property. Based on previous reviews I felt this hotel would suit my needs in the area of Paris that I wished to stay. Hotel de l'Abbaye is located in the Saint Germain district of Paris and the various sites that I was interested in seeing were in walking distance. I was delighted upon my arrival to find the hotel spotless and staff welcoming. The large floor to ceiling window in my room opened overlooking a beautiful enclosed courtyard filled with much greenery and a babbling fountain. It was a very tranquil setting and much appreciated after days of traveling. The room provided a safe in one of the closets and locks on both closets. There was a flatscreen TV and all the amenities that a fine property provides. The bathroom was modern, roomy and clean along with a hairdryer. A continental breakfast was included in the room rate. Coffee or tea is freshly brewed and served in a lovely pot along with croissants, various breads, butter and jams. The servicer was very polite, friendly and enjoyed his job. He genuinely waited upon each person in the room as an honored guest. The front desk staff were very helpful with any question and/or request. I will definitely choose Hotel de l'Abbbaye again upon my future returns to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “charming, helpful”
Reviews.Author: caIgarygirI
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. It's clean, and the service is excellent. Also, the staff were friendly and helpful. They recommend great restaurants, and are great about calling taxis for you, or making reservations, or getting other info. The hotel is a short walk from Parc Luxebourg - which is gorgeous. It's in St Germaine, which is a great shopping district (take a map! the streets are pretty confusing). The included breakfast consists of jam and croissants/other pastries, plus coffee or juice. They charge extra for menu items. Anyway, we were quite happy with the croissants. The breakfast room and lobby are super comfortable. The former overlooks a quaint courtyard and the latter is amply supplied with every variety of magazine and newspaper. The room itself is Paris-sized for sure, but we certainly didn't feel cramped. It's comfortable and clean, with a nice big bathtub. For its price range, I would certainly recommend the Abbaye.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: sesame67
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay. Charming ambience with delightful staff who are so eager to please whatever the request. Small but very adequate and well-maintained bedrooms and bathrooms and we felt like we were in a real home-from-home. The location is perfect for getting around Paris - very near to the Metro and buses and many excellent shops and restaurants nearby. La Maison du Jardin is a few minutes away and is a delightful restaurant which makes a great place to eat if you arrive in Paris tired and hungry ! And as you step into the quiet side street of rue Cassette, the hustle and bustle of Paris melt away. As they say in their brochure, the hotel is "a haven of comfort, excellent service and elegance." We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Hotel L'Abbaye St. Germain”
Reviews.Author: JohnGAtlantaGA
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully attentive staff service their guests in this delightful Left Bank hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Charm and Gentility”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticGal
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 8am, exhausted and rumpled from an all night flight across the Atlantic. The front desk, after appologizing that our room would not be ready til 1pm, immediately suggested we leave our baggage, utilize the lavatory facilities, send an email home announcing our arrival if we liked and enjoy a complimentary breakfast in the garden conservatory. Their attention and concern set the tone for our two night stay. While our room was small, it was nicely decorated, and quiet, overlooking their lovely garden. Their cafe au lait was the best we had during our 4 weeks in France. When I had a problem confirming a leased car, the desk staff helped me work through it. When I tried practicing my French, they politely answered in French. Since they all spoke excellent English, however, they also switched to English whenever I seemed confused or if I asked a question in English. The hotel's public space was cozy and charming, the location was great, the staff delightful. I would happily stay here again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Qizus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Paris for a long awaited trip in September 2008 and stayed at Hotel de L'Abbaye in Saint Germain. It was the perfect place for us. The location was great with many choices of small french restaurants nearby, as well as shopping and metro. Many of the places we wanted to visit were within a 15 - 20 minute walk. The hotel was beautiful, peaceful, the staff outstanding. It was a treat to go to the lovely dining area overlooking a courtyard every morning for a continental breakfast included in the cost. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I concur with the good reviews but...”
Reviews.Author: nerv0usflyer
Reviews.Content: ...it was very pricey for what it was. Let me start with the good points! Firstly, the location was fabulous in the heart of the Latin Quarter and it is a few moments walk from Boulevard Saint Germain. Secondly, the building is beautiful and welcoming and we felt like we were returning to our own cosy pad at the end of a day's sightseeing. Great log fire and a plethora of reading material to cosy up to on plush sofas. Then there was the staff who could not have been any nicer. They did their utmost to ensure our comfort. The room was clean, quiet and small. On the subject of size, this was ok. All Parisien rooms are on the small side unless you are staying at the Crillon! Downsides: We found it to be quite pricey - maybe just a tad overpriced for what it was Our double bed was two singles pushed together. This was actually fine but my single bed was lumpy and uneven. I am sure this was just a fluke and, in any case, my other half obligingly swapped with me. But for the price of the room, I would have expected beds to be in tip-top shape I know folks on here have raved about the breakfast but it was nothing special. It was just what you get in any other Paris hotel e.g. croissants and bread, butters and jams etc. and a rather pedestrian cup of coffee. We went elsewhere for my morning cappuccino and it would have been nice to have had a decent cup with my croissant - this is Paris after all. Anyway the breakfast was fine but don't go expecting anything special. The courtyard provided a lovely breakfast room. No shower in the room - just a bath (lovely bathroom though!) Would I go back? Yes I think I would but I would try to get a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great”
Reviews.Author: Gone_Irish
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, near lots of cafes, resturants and attractions, all withihn walking distance. We took the Eurotrain in from London and than it was an easy metro ride and a two minute walk to the hotel. The staff was excellent and very accomodating. The room service was very friendly and fast. We got a duplex with a terrace and had breakfast served to us in our room. Although the room needed a bit of an update, both the modern bathroom and the outside terrace made up for it..

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjl2178
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old daughter and I just recently returned from a great trip to London & Paris. After having spent 4 nights in a dark, musty hotel in London(was advertised as a 4 star), Hotel de L' Abbaye was a wonderful refuge. When we arrived in Paris, we got completely turned around and could not find our original hotel I had reservations at. Lionel was so gracious and accommodating, he had a room ready for us in five minutes! The location could not have been better. We were close to the Metro and the Latin Quarter. My daughter really enjoyed the festive atmosphere there! Yes the rooms are small, but so comforting, especially after a jammed packed day of sightseeing. We opened our window at night and slept to the sounds of the fountain below in the beautiful courtyard. Even after all of the exhausting days, when I returned home I felt relaxed and peaceful! Tip: Try the Chic Pizza down the street from the hotel at the corner. Great staff and wonderful pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: weenie3
Reviews.Content: Charming Boutique Hotel in the heart of the Left Bank. Excellent shopping and Cafes in the immediate area. Within easy walking distance of the major Paris sites. We stay at the l'Abbaye with our 3 children and the hotel took excellent care of all our needs. They have a beautiful courtyard where we ate our breakfast and enjoyed evening cocktails. Room Tip: The Suite on the first floor of the hotel includes a sunroom overlooking the courtyard area. Very charming and completely updated! We'll definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globe24/7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend having picked the hotel due to the high rating on Tripadvisor and we were definitely not disappointed. It is true that the location is not super prime but being only a 5 minute walk from Boulevard St Germain one could hardly say it is in the sticks. The ground floor and reception area are nicely decorated and there is a pleasant courtyard to the rear where you can have your evening aperitif. The staff on the front desk were very helpful but we were a little jaded that when we asked for a typical French restaurant we got sent somewhere that was filled with tourists, we could have done that on our own! The rooms are not huge but then again for this price they are above the Parisien average. They are very well decorated and appointed although missing a mini bar / water in the room which should be an automatic for a 4 star hotel. Breakfast is served in the living room and courtyard on the ground floor and is good (Fresh bread and pasteries with a payment extra menu for other) and the service is fine although a little slow. There are also papers in the morning. Overall we had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis In the City”
Reviews.Author: onmyway
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay. The hotel is clean and charming. Standard rooms are small, but, not by European Standards. Bathrooms are completely updated and clean. The lobby and bar are charming. A Parsienne breakfast, bread and coffee is included in the stay. You can find many cafe's along the streets near by if you need more. There are also a la carte eggs other breakfast items if you wish. We never ate lunch or tea at the hotel, but it is avaiable. For a small hotel they also have room service. The highlight is the courtyard breakfast and the quite street. We felt like we had our own town house in Paris. The hotel is a short walk to Jardin du Luxembourg and great shopping. Bon Marche is also a short walk. It is about a 15 minute stroll to Notre Dame and Ille de la cite. While we walked to the champs-elysees and Jardin Tuileries it would be about a 10 euro cab ride. Last year I stayed at the Palais de la Reine in the Place des Vosges. I would reccommend this hotel and area over the Marias any day. Take a cab to the Marais and see the busy streets but stay in the quiet relaxing atmosphere of the L'Abbaye. Also a great place for dinner the hotel reccommend is Maison du Jardin a quik walk around the corner. Right outside the door is Pizza Chic a family friendly great wood grilled pizza place.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: browney99
Reviews.Content: What a great place! We found the staff fantastic - very attentive to our booking and then on our arrival. We missed a connection and as such had a second visit to the hotel a week later. They could not have been more obliging. We travelled with our 14 year old daughter who also enjoyed the hotel. It is convenient to the Metro and the sights. We loved our room a studio room so our daughter was downstairs and we upstairs. We can't wait to stay there agian.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: McShyft
Reviews.Content: We hesistate to further extoll the virtues of this delightful little hotel, lest it becomes even harder to book - but we do appreciate the advice of fellow Trip Advisor travellers and add our plaudits to the pile. It is a mid-priced hotel in an excellent location on the Left Bank, handy to a couple of Metro stations, but it happens to have exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. They reserved opera and restaurant seats for us, called us on our mobile phone to advise that our room was ready, sent us some left items back to Australia free of charge - and the elderly gentlemen serving breakfast made us feel blessed every morning. The rooms were clean and generous (for Paris) and the downstairs atmosphere - for example, over breakfast in the courtyard or having pre-dinner drinks and canapes in the lounge - was gracious and unthreatening for the most timid traveller. Places like this make one wonder why one ever bothers with the pretentiousness of many five-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy, overpriced 4 star”
Reviews.Author: TessaCrause
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. Bedore this hotel we stayed for 10 nights at a 3 star hotel in the Marais district. We were dissappointed with the d Abbaye hotel. The rooms are very small. There was no bar fridge. No bottles of water in the room. The reception staff were quite rude to my daughter on a few occasions. We needed to keep some things food items in the fridge and were made to feel quite uncomfortable about this. The breakfast was basically bread and little else; I put patries in the same category as bread. No tea making facilities either. The beds were very uncomfortable as were the pillows. Breakfast was served in a small dining area that was rather stuffy though quaint I guess. I am comparing this hotel with the Marais 3 star property. Ok the Marais is noiser when you go out on the street but the actual room was not. Despite being a 3 star hotel, the room was very spacious and at least had a bar fridge and a kettle AS WELL which was great. Would not recommend Hotel d Abbaye for anyone else than older couples. Definitely not for families or anyone that wants to keep even a bottle of Perrier cold in their room. I noticed that this hotel recently became a 4 star property. Perhaps they are still trying to wrk out what 4-star actually means.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience at Hotel de l'Abbaye”
Reviews.Author: fullprofessor
Reviews.Content: I travel alot and my overall hotel experience at the Hotel de l'Abbaye is my best ever. The staff was courteous and helpful and was just a pleasure to interact with. Everyone spoke English, or at least enough for my wife and I to have no problem communicating with the hotel staff. The facility was lovely, with a beautiful courtyard, fountain, and outdoor dining area. We especially enjoyed the birds at breakfast, which literally ate bread out of our hands in the courtyard. The room was delightful and done in great taste, as were all the hotel furnishings. The windows of our room opened to the courtyard, which was quiet and peaceful. It could not have been a more attractive and pleasant setting. If I had one thing to do over, I would have upgraded to a room with a shower rather than just a bathtub, but even the bathroom was well done. The hotel is conveniently located at the boundaries of the Latin Quarter, Luxemburg Gardens, and St. Germain, off a quiet side street a couple of blocks from the Saint Sulpice Metro stop. Thus it is convenient to most of city center Paris, especially Left Bank activities. I would go back any chance I had to stay at de l' Abbaye! It was truly a terrific experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “great choice for my family”
Reviews.Author: iluv10s
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews I read on the tripadvisor website I chose this property for my family in Paris. It was an excellent choice. The hotel was perfect! Clean, quiet, close to the metro, and had all the amenties we needed. The staff was excellent and very polite. They were always willing to help. We booked two rooms as our two teenage sons accompanied us on this family vacation. We would definately stay at the Hotel L'Abbaye again and would recommend it to all of our friends. The hotel had a beautiful courtyard where breakfast was served every morning (included). The rooms were on the small side but we did not find this to be a drawback. Who wants to stay in the room when you're in Paris anyway. A self service bike rental station was at the end of the block and the metro station was only around the corner. A perfect way to get around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Now a **** 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbebe
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Hotel de l'Abbaye and it was better than ever. It deserves to have the 4th star. Excellent accomodations, decor, location, staff and value. The breakfast was simple and good. The shrinking dollar was a little shocking, but the pleasures of this hotel and Paris made it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Good on the whole”
Reviews.Author: JackRussellLondon
Reviews.Content: Good on the whole. Room was nice. Location was very good - in nice, smart area of the left bank and very near to the metro and good bus routes. Communal areas of the hotel were very nice, especially the nice courtyard with a fountain. Receiption staff were very polite. Quality of breakfast food and drink was excellent. Service at breakfast was hit and miss. On our last day, we had to wait 35 minutes to get served (even though all they have to do is take your order for drinks, then bring you a basket of croissants etc). Other people, who had arrived much later than us, were served before us and we had to complain. However, it would not put me off staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mecnyc
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in a room in the lowest price category, and it my have, in fact, been the worst room in the hotel--but that certainly doesn't mean it was unacceptable. The room was on the ground floor, with a window onto a dark, enclosed cement courtyard, next to the kitchen. It was very warm in the room (even in April), so we had to keep the window open, but they are very good about the noise, and it was not a problem. The bed was very small for two men of average size--I am accustomed to European travel, and this was a particularly small double bed. This room cost 230 Euros, and would have been well-priced at $1=1E, but at $1.60 to the Euro, it was perhaps not a great value. We inquired, and larger beds are available in the next price category. If you have the money, go for it.What you do get is a superb location on the Left Bank (we walked to everything--but we like walking) and an immaculate hotel with superior service. The absolute best part was petit-dejeuner every morning on the glassed-in terrace overlooking the private garden. It was the most enjoyable breakfast service I have ever had in a hotel--fast, efficient, and delicious. The decor in the lobby is very old world, but the rooms are more minimal (but well-decorated, not hyper-modern, but classic charm) We stayed 4 nights, and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: samanthe
Reviews.Content: We are regular visitors to Paris and have been searching for that perfect place to stay for years. There are a number of hotels we have liked very much, but each one had some drawback (too far from places we like to visit, or, too noisy, or, unfriendly staff, or decor that was not in line with what we like, etc.). So...we kept searching and, this year, found Hotel de l'Abbaye. It is perfection and we plan to make it our home away from home in Paris from now on. The management and staff are so friendly and helpful, the Saint Sulpice neighborhood is convenient and lovely, the common rooms and garden are beautiful, the room we had was excellent, the breakfast was delicious...I could go on and on. There is that divine birdsong to gently nudge you awake in the morning, for instance! We thoroughly enjoyed the concert at Saint Sulpice too...the church is a place so imbued with history and beauty that we have always liked to visit it whenever we could...to be so near to it and in such a wonderful hotel was heaven. We definitely did not want to leave when it was time to go and can't wait for our next stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loving l'Abbaye”
Reviews.Author: chadwicksyd
Reviews.Content: Hotel l'Abbaye came highly recommended and lived up to expectations. The room although small was exquisitely presented in beautiful Parisian style overlooking a lovely courtyard with a well designed and appointed bathroom. The common rooms and courtyard gave a feeling of staying in a beautiful house and the friendly staff only excentuated that sense. The area was central and quiet while being in short walking distance to the busiest and jumping area of Paris. Local cafes and supermarkets were also a great advantage. m+m walsh. Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: LongwoodCricket
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Small. Charming. Great staff! I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Paris Hotel”
