Reviews.Author: PenderynCardiff
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the convenience and service at the Hotel de l'Abbaye, and would like to revisit the hotel on our next visit to Paris - if we can get in. The room was very reasonably priced for the size and standard of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quit oase in the hectic of a big city”
Reviews.Author: MobilUser
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel in walking distance to all tourist sites in down town. Recommendable to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de l'Abbaye is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Lisie62
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this quaint little hotel for a one night stop coming from Italy on the way to the US. My cousin and I (2 women) had already been in France for 10 days and Italy for 5 days. The hotel is located in a great area of Paris with terrific shopping. It is close to Saint-Sulpice and within walking distance of The Louvre. The hotel staff was excellent and upgraded our room to a suite which was wonderful. Hotel l'Abbaye is quiet and peaceful with a beautiful garden terrace out back where we ate breakfast the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “WE thoroughly enjoyed our stay and have recommended the Hotel to friends”
Reviews.Author: Lopezchatham
Reviews.Content: The rooms are charming, somewhat small, but larger than many other Paris Hotels. Public areas are great and the glassed in breakfast area right in the garden is superb. We've already been spreading the word and fully intend to stay again when we come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Too short a stay”
Reviews.Author: tsdsw7
Reviews.Content: Have been to Paris many times-first at this hotel. We were only for one night after having visited the Loire Valley. Great location-would most certainly return when visiting Paris for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pichuyos
Reviews.Content: A charming little hotel with great attention to detail. Quiet, but very close to all the action on St. Germain and the Latin Quarter. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful, great dinner recommendations. We had a "large" room, which wasn't large by US standards, but which did have a wonderful breakfast nook off of the hotel's main patio in the back. Plenty of privacy however. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: OhioBob8
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Abbaye was a great selection. If you are trying to select a hotel on line you know how many there are to choose from and our choice was magnificent. The staff was great from the time we arrived to when we left. The front desk helped with directions, restaurants, etc. All of the staff was courteous, efficient and accomadating. Close to the metro - two lines within 2 - 5 minutes easy walk. Great courtyard garden that allowed you to awake to the sound of singing birds. Quiet and peaceful. You didn't even realize you were in a major city. I can't say enough about how pleased we were.

Reviews.Title: “A totally positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Tyma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated near to some of the best shopping streets but in a quiet road. We had one of the duplex rooms which was sensational with a little private terrace which was a sun trap. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is not cheap but much more memorable than some of its bigger rivals. We will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Staff was the best. Dining was very good.”
Reviews.Author: Gnsams_msn_comGerald
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Germain. Rooms were beautiful, neighborhood was great. Hotel staff was great. We couldn't have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet unspoilt paris!”
Reviews.Author: bigmacdonald
Reviews.Content: Quiet oasis in a throbbing city,. Beautiful public rooms with lovely internal garden,very helpful staff. Standard rooms tiny but well maintained.Bathroom supplies limited to shampoo, moistener and soap only. Would recommend and go back, though expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful & perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Murphy553
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Paris and the hotel L'Abbaye just added to the whole weekend. It is situated in the St Germain area 2 minutes walk form St Sulpice metro station or 10 minutes walk from the south bank of the river. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. Always very polite and courteous. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and well furnished. In general - we would recommend the hotel to anyone for its peaceful, out of the way, yet ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Just Delightful”
Reviews.Author: rscnyc-travel
Reviews.Content: A wonderful little hotel just blocks from the Jardin du Luxembourg, and the other wonderful parts of the 6th. Breakfast in the lobby and wintergarden and late night drinks there too made this the perfect little boutique hotel for me. Rooms are adequate, well considered, and well appointed. it is a little pricey but mainly because of the weak dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: o1jerkbait
Reviews.Content: Good attentive service from staff, couple of light bulbs out in the room

Reviews.Title: “Very close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: mandy8gal
Reviews.Content: I will tell you what I was looking for and I think you will see that the Hotel de L'Abbaye Saint-Germain came very close to being perfect. My husband prefers a 5 star hotel that has American type amenities like a stall shower and big screen TVs. My daughter and I don't care about the stars, we want something with personality, charm and lots of nearby strolling opportunities. We booked two rooms - one standard, which had two twin beds and a bath with handheld shower. Very charming, very comfortable - a little roomier than the European standard. The other room was a suite and it was just huge! It was actually a duplex with one floor having a small parlor with TV, couch, easy chair, desk and a full bath with tub and shower stall. The upstairs had a very roomy bedroom, queen size bed, half bathroom (just a toilet /sink) and a terrace that looked over the courtyard with two chairs and a table. Charming!!!! And the bathroom turned out to be my husband's favorite ever - heated floor in the shower, real water pressure, gorgeous marble. Not to mention that all TVs were large, flat panel. I heartily agree with previous posts that mention how very special the service is, on this level they can compete with any 5 star. And the public spaces for breakfast / evening cocktail / relaxation are great too. One very small criticism - the beds were just average in terms of comfort. The mattresses were quite firm and the sheets had that starched feeling, something I thought had gone out of style a long time ago. We had stayed at a Sofitel in Dijon the night before and while that is a very businessy hotel, the beds were incredible. Since Sofitel sells these mattresses through a brochure, I would suggest that the L'Abbaye grab a few of them ASAP. Well worth the price, even the upgrade cost for the suite.

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel of the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: bordeux
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Paris for the first time this month and stayed at the Hotel L'Abbaye. We absolutely loved it! The moment I walked in the front door I felt at home. Our room overlooked the small court yard in the back and it had these beautiful crank out windows that we could crack open and wake up to the birds singing every morning. It was great! The room was very clean and considerably spacious for a smaller hotel. The cleaning service was like clock work everyday, cleaning the room and also providing turn down service in the evening. The common areas of the hotel are the highlight. The sitting area by the fireplace is beautiful and the court yard with the small water fountain is very tranquil if the weather is warm enough to sit out there. There is ample sitting areas where you have breakfast in the morning and a glass of wine in the evening. The staff at this hotel is extremely professional and accomodating. They were very helpful with restuarant reservations and any other questions we had. I thought they were all very warm and friendly, especially Daniel who works the night shift. I highly recommend this hotel and think this is one of the better hotels I have stayed at. I think the location is perfect because it is off the beat and path which makes it quiet but you are just a five minute walk from Boulevard Saint Germain and the Metro. This is a fantastic hotel in a fantastic city! Ron Duxbury, MA

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: absc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Paris for 2 nights at Valentines 2008. It was our first visit to Paris together and we wanted to stay somehere special so we chose the lovely Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint Germain since it was recommended in our AA guide book and had virtually universal acclaim on Trip Advisor. Although close to the cafes and restaurants of Saint Germain and even closer to the useful Saint Sulpice metro station (and only about 10 minutes walk to the Seine), the hotel is an oasis of peace and quiet set around a lovely little courtyard. We paid extra for a large room and had a delightful ground floor room with its own little conservatory (containing 2 chairs and table with fruit basket) and its own little garden (with another 2 chairs and table), both of which overlooked the courtyard. Despite being in the heart of the city the only noise we could hear was birdsong! The staff are all friendly and helpful and speak perfect English (but were also prepared to humour my attempts to communicate with them in French!) and we would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay somewhere a bit special. Breakfast in the main conservatory is recommended (try the hot chocolate, it may not sound particularly breakfasty but is to die for, trust me!) as is afternoon tea in the lounge (in front of a real fire if like us you visit during the winter months). Beyond the hotel we only had time to do the cheesy touristy things (Louvre, Bateaux Mouches cruise, up the Eiffel Tower, dinner/show at the Lido, walks along the Seine), all of which were hugely enjoyable and are highly recommended, but hardly "hidden gems"!! All in all, a perfect escape!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: mike_tedders
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay here for four nights in Feb. Room was great. It wasn't large but had a good sized bath. Particularly enjoyed having breakfast in the conservatory. Location is excellent. At €250/night it is quite expensive - but probably fairly priced for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: DevonPathfinder
Reviews.Content: On arrival i was a little concerned our room,located at the top of the hotel,would be less than private because a team of decorators were operating just outside in the hallway. In the event they were quiet with no real problems. We loved the peace and efficiency of the hotel and the staff, who,without exception were friendly and courteous, the breakfasts were delicious served in the attractive atrium made this a lovely experience ,a particular feature was the REAL fire in the lounge,-for me a wonderful bonus. Overall a very happy stay,and i would have no hesitation in recomending the hotel to one and all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: jbax
Reviews.Content: Loved it - staff was friendly, location couldn't have been better for great shopping, sight seeing, etc., room was nice if a bit flowery, but very clean, very spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “l'Abbaye is spectacular”
Reviews.Author: dannyindc
Reviews.Content: Small and comfortable. No shower curtain/door but thats a European thing from what I have been told. The mattress was a little soft but the service was absolutely spectacular. The dinning room was an indoor/outdoor sunroom that was perfect for morning breakfast and coffee before exploring the city. Exploring the city was made easy by the hotels location and easy access to many lines on the metro. Spectacular location, very professional and courteous help, and very clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel as the place to stay for the price range.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonHappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel de l'Abbaye for 6 days over the New Year holiday. There were large floral arrangements of white amarylis and white hyacinths all throughout the lobby which was one of the little touches that were so wonderful in this hotel. The breakfast area looked out onto a well designed garden area displayed with red cyclamen, white daffodils, and more hyacinths. This hotel makes you feel special and relaxed because of these eye-pleasing touches. The staff was always polite, welcoming and very efficient and helpful with our varied questions. Our room was one of the apartment rooms and we had quite a large bathroom with a shower and a bath. The housekeeping service was very good, and we were happy with our room which had an upstairs bedroom and downstairs living area. We hope to return again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bikeman50
Reviews.Content: This is a very charming, quiet hotel close to a Metro stop, shopping and good restaurants. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful (very proficient with English). A typical French continental breakfast was included. Although we had a standard room that is quite small by any measure, it was attractively decorated (this being Paris) with an efficient layout. We thought the hotel offered a very good value for the money and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaecenasOggi
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful little hotel, beautifully located with exceptional service. Especially wonderful were the continental breakfasts, which are served anytime after 7 in a beautiful room with a coutyard/garden view. The hotel is exceptionally clean and very nicely appointed. The staff were attentive and helpful. The only negative is that we were given an icredibly tiny double room upon arrival, so small that there was not even room for the suitcases, and with not a single drawer of storage space. But the hotel staff happily moved us to a larger (but not especially spacious) room after we complained. The baths are nice but small, often with a tub but without shower. So if you don't mind a cozy room, this is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paris December 2007”
Reviews.Author: charUk
Reviews.Content: Very good welcome and service generally - we were however very surprised to find a person sleeping in the area for the television on the ground floor outside our room! This did not seem at all appropriate for this standard of hotel - but everything else was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: OxfordAdventurer
Reviews.Content: Hotel provides the perfect sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of St-Germain. Within easy walking distance of most major attractions - Louvre, the Seine, Notre Dame etc. Welcoming log fires and comfy sofas. Excellent staff, always friendly and helpful - good English spoken. Good quality continental breakfast served in conservatory dining room overlooking the courtyard. Bedroom not huge but well equipped and good for a big city hotel. Looking forward to our return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Paris! Stay all over the world and nothing compares to your staff!”
Reviews.Author: theflore
Reviews.Content: I had seen this hotel when I was living in Paris in the 90's and thought it quite charming. This is my favorite neighborhood in all the city. But, nothing can compare to the facilities and the staff in your hotel. I stay all over the world and have never stayed in such a quiet, perfect, serene location. It has reminded me of how much I miss about French culture and inspired me to plan a long-stay summer trip with you this year. I have missed Paris. I plan to communicate my pleasure with both Michelin and Conde Nast Traveller as I think this boutique hotel is far under rated. I was treated as if I stayed at Hotel de l'Abbaye on a regular basis. I shudder to think what is done for those who do. I could not have felt more welcome or comfortable. You are running a top ship and very fortunate to have the staff you do. And I mean ALL your staff. I could go on and on, but I fear I shall run out of space. Thank you to everyone for a lovely stay and for reminding me how very much I love Paris. I owe it all to you!

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend at the St Germain”
Reviews.Author: mjosecouto
Reviews.Content: Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Germain it is very nicely located, near Saint Sulpice and St Germain churches, Luxembourg Palace and it’s beautiful gardens and many other lovely places within walking distance, such as Notre Dame, Monparnasse Cemetery, it is very charming and the decoration it is lovely. The room was a bit small, but it was so charming you forget about it. We took advantage of the nice sitting rooms downstairs, the fireplace, the winter garden overlooking the small garden and it’s fountain. We have paid € 215 breakfast included. The staff was nice too. A place to be back. 14 to 19 November 2007

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: MisterJensen
Reviews.Content: The interior decoration of the rooms is special; very well done. Excellent boutique hotel just off Rue de Rennes, in a quiet petite courtyard setting. Professional, friendly and helpful staff. Would recommend it to all my friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great staff and perfect location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: davidlillian
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in St. Germain. Service excellent and room quite nice. Have stayed there in the past and will on future trips to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Germain”
Reviews.Author: McDales
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Germain is wonderful. It is very quiet with an off the street location but all of the key sites are in easy walking distance. The rooms are lovely and comfortable. The staff was friendly, helpful and provided great suggestions on local Restaurants. After a busy day on business or site seeing the hotel is a great place to return. I have stayed at several different hotels in Paris over the years and the Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Germain is now my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “The bathroom should have a shower”
Reviews.Author: RiodeJaneiroViajante
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very good. You must sit down in the bathtub in order to use the hand shower. Also there is no refrigerator in the room.

Reviews.Title: “At Last - Our Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTinker
Reviews.Content: A courtyard entrance, a rear garden, clean comfortable rooms, discreet personal service, peace and quiet - if this suits you as it suits us, this is the place for you. In a quiet road in St-Germain close to the shops but a reasonable distance away the L'Abbaye is an oasis. Breakfast is very simple. A hot drink of choice with orange juice and a basket of bread, pastries and preserves served in the lounge and conservatory on the ground floor. There is no restaurant. We were guided to (and booked in at )the excellent La Maison du Jardin 27 rue de Vaugirard 200 yards from the hotel. A small local restaurant serving excellent food at good prices 25euros for two courses, 30 euros for three, house wine at 9euros per 50cl. Other wines well-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jupper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice while traveling through France. The location is close to the Luxembourg Garden on quiet side street. The staff is very helpful and kind. Breakfast is available in a warm series of rooms or the garden. The staff will gladly bring coffee (with rolls and fresh juice) to your room in the morning. During our first stay we we were in room 42 on the top floor. It looked over the garden and was quite comfortable. On the second stay we were in room 3 on the reception floor. Room 3 includes a sun room built into the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet and over the top and worth it”
Reviews.Author: slpatterson
Reviews.Content: This is a small place, close to what you will want to see, even for old hats of Paris. The staff will speak English if you do and will speak French if you do, even if you speak poorly. The Amex bill will floor you on return, but there is no better place to stay in Paris. And don't forget to toss a crumb or two to the birds at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Abbaye Saint-Germain”
Reviews.Author: allsalt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in May 2007. A perfect location, quiet elegant hotel, prompt and kind service, with a good breakfast in a lovely location. We had room #4 with a patio with chair and table. Close to Metro and on a quiet street. The only thing we did not like here is the lack of shower as the tub had only a hose spray. Staff spoke English if you so desired and the room was always cleaned promptly and very well. Can't say enough positive things. This is a quiet place, probably not for families or loud people. We are a 50 somthing couple and this suited quite well. They also made all our dinner reservations via email prior to our arrival (from our selections). Arrangements were all seemless. Will stay here again as soon as we can get back.

Reviews.Title: “You Won't Be Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: marysj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in Sept 06 and again in Feb 07. It is a charming hotel in a wonderful part of Paris. Rooms are well appointed, staff are very friendly and the breakfast good. Great air conditioning too in a hot and muggy Paris! We used to stay in another hotel about 5 minutes away, but have found this hotel to offer better value for money. It's not 5*, but it is a lovely, small hotel. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Beaucoup d'Americans! No longer a secret”
Reviews.Author: lepetitpois12
Reviews.Content: I have long loved the Hotel de l'Abbaye for its central St-Germain-des-Pres location, charming rooms, personal service. My husband and I just spent a week here April 14-22. Everything was as lovely as ever and I do recommend this hotel whole-heartedly, though it's so popular it's getting awfully hard to book a room these days! My only major gripe: during our stay, the property was overrun, literally, with loud Americans. One group in particular crowded the rather petite breakfast room, pushing together the small tables to create space for 7 people, thus denying a spot for other guests who wanted to breakfast. The rest of us were forced to wait while their table stood half empty. And is it too much to use "indoor voices"? Americans -- please note that your voices do indeed carry and I, for one, don't want to hear about your upcoming shopping trips to J. Crew while I'm on a romantic weekend away with my husband. Also, it's inconsiderate to stand about talking in the hall and slamming doors when the doors are quite thin. I realize that this post seems a bit curmudgeonly, but the "hidden" Hotel de l'Abbaye is no longer a secret -- particularly among loud-voiced, middle-aged American women from North Carolina. If you have a low threshold for irritation, avoid. I've realized that I need to start looking for another "secret" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paris charm”
Reviews.Author: ryanflyin
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were guests April 10-16. I had looked extensively for the right hotel and was so pleased with the l'abbaye! Everyone was friendly and accomodating. Upon arrival the type room (large twin double) was not available, so the first night we spent in a duplex suite. It was sooo charming. I toyed with the idea of staying there. Sensibility prevailed, and the next morning we moved to the room expected. It too was lovely. There was enough room for storage as well as a small couch and coffee table where we had our breadfast a number of mornings. One disappointment was the common rooms were under refurbishment, so things were not perfect, however this was minor really. There is a lovely garden and lounge area. Each day we made it a point to relax a bit at the end of the day or in the late afternoon. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to experience a bit of Paris charm. Enjoy this magnificent city. It is truly the city of Lights.!!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of tranquility, charm and service in the heart of the Rive Gauche.”
Reviews.Author: W00dy20stkw
Reviews.Content: Last fall when I received a notice from Air France offering very inexpensive winter fares I booked a flight on Valentine’s Day to take my wife Paris for a short stay. Based upon the strong recommendation of a colleague from work and the Trip Advisor ratings (at that time Hotel de l’Abbaye was ranked #10) I made a reservation for four nights. After being stuck on the ground at JFK Airport for nearly 7 hours due to an ice storm we arrived in Paris after spending 13 ½ hours in the plane. When we reached the hotel we knew we’d made a great choice. You walk through two large doors into the cobblestone courtyard and enter a series of charming common rooms – one with a working fireplace. At reception we were greeted warmly and whisked up to our room. As soon as we got there our frustration and disappointment of losing most of our first day in Paris melted away. As our tickets were so cheap, I splurged and booked one of their duplex suites. It was like we had our own private apartment on the Left Bank. There was a welcome note from the hotel’s manager and a basket of incredible fresh fruit. Paris rewarded us with early Spring weather – high 50’s and low 60’s and sunny. So we were able to use the balcony of our room every day to eat breakfast or lunch or have drinks. The Hotel de l’Abbaye was exactly the type of hotel we’ve been looking for in Paris. On prior trips we’ve stayed on the Ile St. Louis and large “institutional” hotels on the Right Bank. L’Abbaye is smaller and more intimate in a terrific location. It is close to several Metro stations and different lines as well as the shops and sights of St. Germain des Pres. At the same time at night it was extremely quiet – we used to live in NYC and we could not believe we were in the heart a major city. Because the weather was so warm the windows in the apartments across the street were open and we could hear their conversations. I can’t say enough for the service we received. I booked the room using the hotel’s website. The staff was very responsive and helpful. I also communicated with the staff regarding restaurant reservations. They were able to get us into each restaurant we requested. When a restaurant was booked for one day, they worked with me on alternative times that fit our schedule. They also suggested a local restaurant for dinner on Sunday night (when many restaurants in Paris are closed) and it turned out to be an excellent meal. Our room was spotlessly cleaned each day, and we enjoyed the complimentarily continental breakfast which is an additional charge at most Paris hotels. And the desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. I speak a bit of French and they indulged me by communicating in French. My wife doesn’t speak any French and they effortlessly switched between English and French when she was with me. The hotel was the perfect spot for us to start our walking tours of various parts of Paris. And a welcome home to return to. And we will return to the Hotel de l’Abbaye again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing bed & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Brit_in_LA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the L'Abbaye on an long (2 week) buisness trip to Paris. It's a pleasant, quiet, clean hotel, as one would naturally hope for an official four star (the above info is incorrect). Every other aspect of my stay was however frustrating; added up I was ultimately very disappointed in my stay. - My booked double bed (I'm very tall) turned out to be two singles pushed together, with single sheets. I asked for a proper large bed and was told there wasn't one available (and that two singles was the default in France?) but they could remake the bed with double sheets. I later taked to the manager and was moved to a (slightly inferior!) room with a decent bed. - When I rang to extend & confirm my booking (the hotel did not respond to emails to their published address) I specifically asked whether internet (essential for my work) was included in the price (the website is ambigious on this point). This was confirmed by the front desk. I found a paid wifi service on my arrival. I was then told there was free wired Internet but the wall jacks in both rooms in which I stayed were dummies (no connection pins). The manager gave me a very limited time wifi card in compensation; I ended up spending an extra 150 euros over my stay (I didn't bother trying to get this back as work paid, but still vexing). - The included breakfast is very limited; a hot drink, and small glass of juice, and some pastries/bread/jam. The quality is decent but no options, nothing savoury, no fruit, no refils. It's the worst hotel breakfast I've had at several hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, Great Location and Charming”
Reviews.Author: gethappy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days and I recommend this hotel highly. The rooms were small (as are most in Paris) but impeccably clean, great linens on the bed - small tub with spray nozzle - marble bathrooms, large french doors that opened to the courtyard with a fountain and birds each morning. We stayed in the back of the building. Also don't miss breakfast in the Garden room - coffee, juices and pastries. It was our honeymoon - we returned to the room one night to a bottle of champagne, crackers and some olives on a lovely tray with a personalized note. Great location - metro nearby and the most outrageous outdoor food market 2 blocks away with the best fresh food Paris has to offer - I had an orange and a pear that where the best I ever ate - we also got some fresh quiche, bread, cheese and a bottle of wine there.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on where your room is...”
Reviews.Author: plurgirl
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of visiting Paris this past December. You cannot beat the location of this hotel. It is surrounded by shops, restaurants, and near a metro. Pros- Great location, nice friendly service, the room size was fine for a european room. cons-NOISE! we spent one night in a room that faced the main street. Trust me it wasn't bearable. I put in earplugs from the flight over, took half a sleeping pill and still couldnt sleep. I am not a complainer. If you are going to stay in this hotel I would pass on the cute street view and book a room in the back of the hotel. We asked to be moved and they were very nice. We had a new room one night later. I had read some reviews others wrote about the rooms getting super hot. Even in december when we would get back in the evening we would need to open the windows because it would get so hot. I would be a little apprehensive about staying here in the summer. Also...it rained every single day we there and it was pretty miserable. I wouldnt recomend going in Dec. We went because we had vacation time that had to be used. The restaurant- I would go atleast once because it is cute but IMO it's not worth 10 euros. The only hot food there are the eggs. Enjoy Paris! I cannot wait to go back!~!

Reviews.Title: “I love de L'Abbaye- charming, warm, and great location”
Reviews.Author: Sworn2Fun
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris many times, and had had this hotel recommended to me more than once- didn't book it until a trip with a girlfriend to "hang out in cafes, shop, and wear red lipstick". The rooms are small, true, but for the price in Paris perfectly fine. Nice marble-y bathrooms with everything you need. The public rooms are the real show here- no less because we arrived in a very rainy week. There is a lovely living room with a fireplace - bit of a contest to see who can snag the comfy armchairs closest to the fire and read all day- and a solarium where you take breakfast. There is also a small bar, which of course is almost empty and only really hotel guests, so, unlike many Paris hotels, you can spend quite a lot of time in your hotel but still have a drink or just be out of your room. The location is killer- smack in the middle of the 6th near all the best shopping and great cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Left Bank Find”
Reviews.Author: NYC91
Reviews.Content: Thanks to TripAdvisor, we were lucky to find this charming gem in the heart of the left bank. Booked direct through the hotel and were given room 23. Yes, it was a bit small, but the bathroom was a nice size and never felt cramped (this is Europe after all, most hotel rooms aren't nearly as large as the US). FYI, tub/shower had no curtain. Just somehting to be aware of. This hotel is great for several things: romance, location, staff, value. If you want a truly romantic Paris experience for a decent price, stay here. It is hard to find a great hotel for 200-215 Euros, so I think this is a great deal for the money. Breakfast was served in the charming parlor room downstairs. Staff was extremely helpful and courteous. ALSO, this hotel was just bumped from a 3 star to a 4 star hotel, while we were there. Prices may go up, but we hope not! I would definately stay at this hotel again for my next trip to Paris. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Standard doubles are tiny, dark, and nosy.”
Reviews.Author: marianneNyc
Reviews.Content: Pleasant staff, pleasant public rooms, pleasant breakfast BUT if you stay here do not stay in a standard double room-- either stay in a superior room or suite or go to another hotel. The standard doubles are small (like a NYC maid's room), the double bed JUST fits, our room looked out on a small dark courtyard. The room was stuffy but the courtyard was noisy as it looked out on the kitchen and office. To upgrade was about $140/night. So, my recommendation is stay someplace else unless you can afford a higher level room. There is NOTHING more depressing on a vacation than having a tiny, dark, noisy room which is not that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “small, but very nice”
Reviews.Author: preppride1798
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a bit small, but the hotel makes effective use of every inch of space with built in cabinets and such. The room felt like a luxury room on a cruise ship. We where traveling with a large suitcase and two large carry ons and were able to stow away everything so we could get around. I would recommend getting a twin room, even if traveling as a couple. They are put side to side like a king anyway. You could run the A/C even in October and you can control the thermostat. So A/C in the summer probably won’t be an issue. Some reviews complained about the noise level at the hotel. I didn’t notice any big issue and I am a very light sleeper. We had room 19 which was at the top of the staircase, with a window facing the front courtyard, directly over the reception and lobby area and below another room. Quite possibly the noisiest room in the hotel, and noise was not an issue. This is of course with the caveat that you are in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Paris and in a building that was built before noise ordinances were invented. You will hear occasional noise from the street and people in the hall. But the hotel is located in a very quite street of Paris and most of the hotels guests are the older type who just want to relax and go to bed after having dinner. The staff is friendly and courteous. Most speak English. They have free internet access 24/7. It gets quite busy in the morning. It’s only one computer. Breakfast is nice and free, but does get boring. The restaurant next door is very good. It serves French country food. The hotel is also located within two famous pastry stores. The very upscale Pierre Hermé and the more traditional Luduree (both on rue Bonaparte). Luduree has a café. It was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The most fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: JoannefromUK
Reviews.Content: We cannot recommend this wonderful little jewel of a boutique hotel enough, in the centre of where you want to be on a lovely quiet street in Paris, perfect for Luxembourg Gardens, St Germain, Pantheon etc, everything in walking distance. The hotel is entered through a private courtyard into lovely lobby with the prettiest communial areas, lots of sofas and soft seats and a lovely log burning fire at night. We booked a larger double which was huge with its own little conservatory with table and squidgey chairs AND the room even had its own little courtyard garden which was lit up beautifully at night, really comfy beds and huge bath - we just loved it. All the staff were helpful and welcoming, particularly the night time barman who served wonderful hot chocolates and the lovely chaps serving the fabulous croissants and tea for breakfast. We will only ever stay at Hotel de L'Abbaye when we visit Paris. I would say it is perfect for any age group, we are 30 somethings but I could see younger and older customers loving it too!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL de L'ABBAYE- A Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tuscan10s
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, and I stayed at Hotel de l'Abbaye for 4 nights in early September. We travel frequently to Paris and have stayed in 3, 4, and 5-star hotels, but none have impressed us as much as the Abbaye for location, service and value. It is centrally located on a quiet street minutes from the metro station, Luxembourg Gardens, St. Sulpice, St. Germain, and Latin Quarter; surrounded by great shopping (Longchamps just 5 mins. away) and wonderful restaurants. Poliane, a bakery mentioned in several guide books and known for their delicious apple tarts and custard is just a short walk away on rue Cherche Midi. Yum! There is a small grocery store 1/2 block from the hotel at the corner of Rue Rennes and Rue Cassette (entrance is set back from street and easy to miss) where we bought drinks and snacks. The hotel is charming and cozy wtih beautiful fresh floral arrangements throughout. It is beautifully decorated with many areas to relax, unwind or read including the front courtyard and lovely garden with fountain. The front-desk staff was welcoming and helpful. We arrived in the morning as guests were preparing their day of sightseeing and had the opportunity to watch as the staff responded to the numerous questions and requests (and a couple of demands from a rude guest!)- it was all handled professionally, effeciently, and with a smile. Our room was a double with an added roll-away. Our one regret was that we didn't book one of the larger rooms as it was a bit small for the three of us. It was on the 3rd floor overlooking the front courtyard. We thought we would get noise from the street, but it was very quiet. At night, the courtyard is closed off from the street by huge wooden doors which helps with any noise. The bathroom was large, bright, modern, and extremely clean. If you prefer, you may want to request a room with a shower as some come with a bathtub and hand-held nozzle. The breakfast, included in the price our room, was simple but delightful. Delicious freshly baked pastries, bread, orange juice, coffee,tea and hot chocolate were served by a kind, hard working man in the sun room and garden courtyard. I particularly enjoyed the table service; not having to juggle plates and cups from a buffet. On the morning of our early (5:30am) departure, the very nice and attentive front-desk person (failed to get his name; grey hair with glasses), served us breakfast, called a taxi, stood outside in the dark waiting for the taxi to arrive while we ate, carried our very heavy suitcases to the taxi (sparing sleeping guests the noise of rolling wheels on cobblestones), gave the driver instructions, and stood in the cold waving "au revoir" as we drove away. We were sad to leave. We had an enjoyable stay at Hotel de l'Abbaye and will recommend it to our friends and family. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but more than a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: Milo47
Reviews.Content: GOOD NEWS Very close to St. Sulpice Metro and excellent restaurant (Cafe Cassette). No smell, even though not officially non-smoking. Quiet, clean, comfortable, flat-screen TV, magnificent bathroom (both tub and shower). Superb espresso (on the house while we waited, see below). Did not eat (expensive) breakfast there but opted instead for Cafe Cassette just down the street. Professional desk staff spoke adequate English and watched our baggage before check-in and after check-out. BAD NEWS Check-in time was supposedly noon, but the room was not ready until 3 pm. We had an espresso on the house, then explored a bit, then had another espresso, and finally got into the room (professional staff took all luggage up the elevator within 3 minutes of our entry). Paid 244 EUR per night (4 nights), which really felt more than a little expensive. In the Parisian scheme of things, however, it was probably worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vespadirk
Reviews.Content: Lovely place to stay. After reading the reviews on tripadvisor, my girl-friend and I decided to go for this hotel. The staff were very helpful with everything our hearts desired (calling a cab, giving us directions, carrying our bags up to the room and down again when we left), the breakfast was a treat , the rooms were very romantic and clean and the location was superb. All in all a charming hotel with a little flair of luxury. Great for young couples on a romantic visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: roscopcoltraine
Reviews.Content: this hotel is wonderful - the terrace and public areas calming and relaxing, the rooms beautifully decorated and presented... it does feel like you are staying in a private house rather than a hotel. breakfast on the terrace (until 12!!) is so relaxing and most of the staff very helpful and friendly. St Germain is the best place to stay to explore the city; the local restaurants and shops are great. The hotel booked a restaurant for us one evening which was a great choice. thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hewitts
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris in late July and found this cosy hotel a sanctuary in the bustle of Paris. The rooms are indeed small but well equipped and spotless. The staff were helpful and polite and the courtyard area a delight. Overall I found the hotel to be great value for money in an excellent location and look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wandering-FlyFisher
Reviews.Content: Spend 3 nights at Hotel de l'Abbaye recently. It was an outstanding experience. The staff were all excellent, the room was quiet and the breakfast service on the patio was a treat. We liked the location, well away from the more extreme tourist areas closer to the river. Metro and good food nearby. Only negative was the influx of noisy American tourists to the common areas on the weekend but this was not the hotel's fault. We will certainly be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rayjay80
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our first trip to Paris. We made our selection based on the previous great reviews and we agree. This is a great choice for a hotel in Paris. It is within walking distance of all the major tourist sites. The room was clean, decorated nicely, and quiet. It is located on a side street with little traffic, but is within blocks of numerous restaurants in the Saint-Germain area. The staff was very helpful and courteous. They all spoke English, and helped us several times with directions and dinner reservations. Breakfast in the hotel's courtyard was a great way to start the day. While all the restaurants in the area that we tried were great, we thought the restaurant next door was the best meal we had in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in a big city”
Reviews.Author: Calzan
Reviews.Content: I found this little gem on tripadvisor a year ago when planning our dream French holiday. It was rated as number 10 then and during the year I paniced as , although there were no bad results it dropped down in the ratings. Well I think it is due to not a lot of travellers reporting back, so if you have visited, review this hotel to try and get it back to the rating it deserves. It is wonderful. and when you sit in the quaint courtyard for breakfast with the only noise being the fountain and the resident little birds , you cannot believe you are in a big city. The staff where incredibly helpful and their recommendation for dinner up the road was a highlight of incredible food that we ate along the way. The lamb in phyllo speciality is to die for and I am still dreaming of it........ The boulangerie down the road ( the one with the continuous line ) is the best

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful retreat in busy Saint Germain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10-day trip to Paris, and we stayed at the L'Abbaye on the recommendation of a coworker. I stayed in a postage stamp sized room at a small boutique hotel in the Marais the last time I was in Paris, and I did not want to repeat this experience. Therefore, I booked a larger room at the L'Abbaye and we were not disappointed. The room was lovely and had more than adequate closet and drawer space. The safe in the closet was a plus, and the bathroom had all the amenities. The staff was helpful and professional, and they confirmed all our reservations for restaurants and transportation. The main streets and boulevards of Saint Germain are noisy and bustling, so the location of the L'Abbaye on a quiet side street was a plus. The hotel is near two metro stops - St. Sulplice and Rennes - that are on different lines, so you have access to different parts of Paris. It is also near the Gare Montparnasse, where we took the railroad to Chartres. We had two delightful dinners at Le Table de Perigord (on the corner) and the Cafe Cassette on the corner of Rue Cassette and Rennes is a great place for drinks, a light meal, or dessert. When (not if) we return to Paris, we will definately return to the L'Abbaye.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was ideal in every way...”
Reviews.Author: celticmoon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying in this hotel for 9 nights. The hotel staff are personable, helpful and go out of their way for the little things. This was a last minute trip for us (3 weeks preparation) and upon checking their website found out that they were booked the days we wanted, so we called them, and it turned out they had a suite-salon modern available which suited us. We wanted something larger than the standard sized room anyhow. The room was spotless, and the marble bathroom had a tub, separate shower and plenty of room for toiletries. The breakfast of croissants juice and delicious coffee is included, however, there is a menu, if you choose. My suggestion is the hotel could add fruit in addition to the breads. The location is perfect - 5 minute walk to St. Sulpice and the Metro. Plenty of shopping in all directions. We would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smokingjoe
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at this lovely hotel. The service and the staff could not have been nicer and helpful. This hotel is situated in a lovely area just two blocks from the Metro. We opted for the large room and it was great. You will not go wrong with this little gem. Smoking Joe

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: SoCalif08
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single large room with my wife and son. The hotel is extremely well located and within walking distance of many sites and restaurants. Our room was on the second floor (3rd floor American) and looked into an internal courtyard. Although the hotel is centrally located we had a very quiet room. No street noise at all. The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. I recommend the hotel and would stay there again. It is somewhat expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Paris en Printemps!”
Reviews.Author: Turlendu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel de L'Abbaye with my 10 year old daughter in early April '06. Twenty years ago, I spent a college semester in Paris at the nearby Alliance Francaise. I've returned back a number of times and can't get enough of the 6th. This was a special trip with my daughter -- an introduction to the city I love so much and I wanted to make it very special. I'd stayed in a few hotels in the 6th on business, but was intrigued by the reviews I read on Trip Advisor. I researched hotels extensively and Hotel de L'Abbaye was simply the most logical choice. THe hotel is GREAT. The street is very quiet and residential, yet just a half block off the busy Rue de Rennes. It's 5 mins maxby foot to the St Sulpice Metro, 10 mins to St. Germain and about a 15 min walk to the Seine (but I walk fast). The cobblestone entry courtyard is charming. While the hotel is in an old building and has the exceptional charm of a well kept small Parisian hotel, I didn't see any antique elements like wooden beams or stone walls that I'd seen at other small hotels in the 6th. That was ok with me. It's very tidy and well appointed. We were on the third floor overlooking the courtyard. The room was small, but I knew that in advance. The bathroom comparatively was grand. The staff was quiet friendly and allowed me to speak French and spoke French back which was generous. THey were helfpul with restaurant recommendations and with other suggestions during our visit. There were a number of French in the hotel during our stay which was nice to see. THe other hotels I'd stayd at in the 6th were a bit noisy and Hotel de L'Abbaye was no exception. I could hear toilets flushing and other plumbing sounds, but thankfully no talking! It was not a major nuisance and that's part of the charm! THe Luxembourg Gardens -- my hangout in school -- is quite close and there are loads of great restaurants and shipping nearby (as well as one of the city's best patisseries on Rue Bonaparte -- can't remember the name! but it's just a half block N of Place St. Sulipice on the left.. Shopping is great too. I would highly recommend Hotel de L'Abbaye to anyone. It is delightful. Enjoy the magic of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here”
Reviews.Author: Summitsue
Reviews.Content: If you are even thinking of staying here, then you should. We stayed for a week in a one of the "larger" rooms on the first floor. It had a sitting area (very small sun room) with table and 2 chairs. From there you could exit to your own small terrace with a second table and chairs. We were traveling with our 16-year old son, so the room and space was perfect for us. The bathroom had plenty of amenities, which was nice. The soaking tub (inc. hand-held shower) was especially refreshing, after walking around all day. The breakfast was delicious. Fresh fruit was provided in our room. The staff was extremely nice and helped answer all of our numerous questions. The hotel is in a perfect location, close the metro, and within walking distance to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely area!”
Reviews.Author: hamano03
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed 3 nights in March. The Hotel de l'Abbaye turned out to be our favorite hotel durig our trip to France & the UK. The decor of the hotel is elegant but very comfortable. The public areas were very nice, and the breakfast atrium was lovely. The continental breakfast served there was very good and perfect for getting ready for a day of touring. The staff were very professional and genuinely friendly & helpful. Our room was ample, not huge but very comfortable, as was the bathroom which was very well stocked. There was plenty of space to unpack our things in both the bed room & bathroom. The hotel is located in a quiet area near the Luxembourg gardens & St. Sulpice, which made many sights, Musee d'Orsay, St.-Germain, the Latin Quarter, even Ile-de-la-Cite, only a leisurely walk away. To reach attractions further away, we took the Metro from nearby stations. The area doesn't have a jumping nightlife, but there were many excellent restaurants distributed in the nearby Luxembourg/Odeon area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Texian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Nov 19-23. This is a great little boutique hotel. Very friendly staff. All speak English. Unlike most Paris hotels they include breakfast in the room cost. The breakfast is juice, coffee and pastries served by a wonderful hard working man in a nice glassed in garden room. The only negative on this hotel was our bed which was a double made up of 2 very short singles pushed together and made up individually. So it was like being in seperate beds. Seemed a little strange. The rooms are teeny but most are in Paris. The bathroom adequate. Every thing spotless. And very important: it is totally quiet. We would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “L'Abbaye in November”
Reviews.Author: livetotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Abbaye for 7 nights in Mid-November, 2005. We really liked it's quiet location near Luxembourg Gardens in the 6eme. The entrance and the public rooms are charming. The staff is among the friendliest that we have ever dealt with in Paris. The standard room @ 199E is miniscule, and the carpet in our room, number 20, was badly stained along the foot of the beds (as it turns out, the only place you can really "walk" inside the room.) The bathroom was adequate and kept meticulously clean. The daily petit dejeuner that comes included with the price of the room became a bit boring and repetitive after a few days, although the room/s in which it is served are lovely. The breakfast consisted of coffee/tea, orange juice and a small basket of bread (baguette, croissant, sweet roll). The addition of fruit and/or yogurt would be a real plus. Although we enjoyed our stay, we will probably look elsewhere when we return next year, possibly an apartment.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: hdwc
Reviews.Content: My wife, i and another couple stayed at this wonderful small hotel. wonderful and helpful staff. Nova and Nicole are 2 that i remember. great location for dining, shopping, and walking to museums. very near a metro stop.We were in room 30 which overlooked the courtyard and mostly quiet. very nice but small, as expected. our friends were in room 49 which was a slightly bigger though faced towards the street which is a little noisier. Tasty continental breakfast with strong coffee. very good value at 199 euros inclusive of taxes and breakfast. We would definitely stay here again. With regards to the language, we had no problems if you tried a to speak a little french. everyone appreciated that we tried. Internet access: the hotel is wifi. the fee is 25 euros for 24 hours of use. also, there is a computer on the first floor which does not have a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Babymooner2
Reviews.Content: It's the quintissential boutique hotel. Absolutely perfect location. Small, but cute clean rooms. Breakfast included on a closed in patio -- basket of yummy baked goods, fresh squeezed orange juice and coffee. The staff were great. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mais oui!”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne-me2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and daughter in mid Sep 05. We were here for 6 nights and found it to be a great location, yet very quiet (we all slept in first morning and had to rush off to a pre booked tour - staff provided us with breakfast on the run!). There were lots of shops nearby (for me) and Luxembourg gardens a short walk away (for my husband and 11 yr old daughter). We also walked to Musee d'Orsay and the Louvre with not much effort. The food was simple, rooms clean, and service was polite, friendly and helpful. The concierge directed us to a delightful restaurant for dinner. Yes, I would do it all again. The people complaining about bookings and not getting a room should just take note to book earlier, they're just bitter.

Reviews.Title: “gem boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great little gem of a find in the Latin Quarter so close to the St. Sulpice metro stop, in the midst of all the shops and cafes. On a quiet street in the hustle bustle of town. The hotel is set back off the street with a little courtyard. The staff is very friendly and helpful. All speak English. They will recommend restaurants, confirm reservations, everything. There is internet access, they say .15E/minute, but nobody charged me at all. The price is great 199E, European breakfast included, which is enough given the lunch and dinner you're going to eat. The rooms are small, unless you book a larger room or suite, but adequate. The beds are short in the standard room. So if you are tall, book a more expensive room, it will be worth it. The bathroom is nice, blowdryer included. What a great place. We highly recommend it. THis was our 3rd time to Paris, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Schilplin
Reviews.Content: We had booked our room in August, specifying we wanted a superior room as high up as possible. The hotel replied they would do their best to grant our wish. On arrival we were offered a room on the ground floor some distance from the reception desk and next to a lavatory, with a french window going out unto a narrow inside court. The room was dark even in mid-afternoon. When we complained it was pointed out to us with silky smoothness that they had only promised us a room. As rooms were allocated on a daily basis and this was the only one available of that category they were entirely justified and we were utterly wrong in complaining. As an alternative we were offered a standard (i.e. small) room and a "suite" at a 10 per cent discount. We left next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Our new home away from home in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: elmarko
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a gem. Staff is marvelous and most helpful. Location couldn't be better, plus the building is set back from the street and VERY, VERY QUIET. Reception area, lobby and breakfast atrium were extraordinarily well maintained and charming. You couldn't ask for more in a Paris hotel. My wife and I are spoiled and will only stay here from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with personality”
Reviews.Author: jpwfly
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor was right on this one. Great staff and hotel, room was clean.The location was the best. I would return to this one.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Germain
HotelInfo.Address: 10 rue Cassette | 06 Arr., 75006 Paris, France
